commit_message:
Send more info to Astute about cluster operation

In order to make database backup during env updating and restore it
during env rollbacking, we need to send information about current
action (update/rollback) to Astute.

Partial-Bug: #1355180
Change-Id: I02de84b44b4fde28e148d8ae2e822c6a0c75240d

commit_message:
Handle `update` and `rollback` nailgun's messages

Since the patchset [1] Nailgun sends to Astute a specific command what
to do with environment, not a general "deploy". So we need to catch and
handle that properly.

We need this separation in order to implement a proper rollback feature
which includes both database dumping and restoring.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/114505

Change-Id: I7641add71b2a1defbe8ad2f6d8f2f78b34f606b0
Partial-Bug: #1355180

Change looks correct.  I don't have the background to know if it's right for ODL."}, {'account_id': 7787, 'date': '2014-09-21 00:47:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This seems like a pretty significant behavior change with regard to duplicat object errors. Can you add some more ODL people to the review (Kyle Mestery, ??) so it gets good visibility? It looks correct otherwise.'}, {'account_id': 8124, 'date': '2014-09-22 09:01:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11692, 'date': '2014-09-22 12:05:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6993, 'date': '2014-09-22 12:21:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The current ODL REST API implementation doesn't adhere to REST best practices with regard to status codes. It returns 400 status codes in place of a 409 for object exists.

Until the behavior is fixed in ODL upstream (Lithium release cycle, which will be approx 6-9 months from now) I would prefer that this change was not merged."}, {'account_id': 11692, 'date': '2014-09-22 12:41:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Referring to the comment, filtering 400 protects against conflicts with already existing resources. It's linked to a potential ODL bug [1].

Filtering 400 is irrelevant in case of single update operations (no resource creation) and full synchronization (404 was returned during the previous get operation). 

To manage conflict, ODL MD must at least check the content of the already existing resource returned by ODL (ie. provider:segmentation_id). I think it's safer to raise an exception than just checking the ID.

In all cases, filtering 400 masks "real" bad requests.

I added Kyle and Dave as reviewers even if they have already been informed.

[1] https://bugs.opendaylight.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1785'}, {'account_id': 8124, 'date': '2014-09-22 13:16:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11692, 'date': '2014-09-22 13:57:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think it's wrong to wait for the modification in ODL and not to merge this change.

Here some BadRequests are filtered for nothing (full synchronization and single update operation).

The http status codes returned by neutron could also be modified.But it increases the scope of this review."}, {'account_id': 11692, 'date': '2014-09-25 08:51:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8124, 'date': '2014-09-25 08:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

fine for me'}, {'account_id': 11692, 'date': '2014-10-01 08:29:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Stop ignoring 400 errors returned by ODL

This commit stops ignoring 400 (Bad Request) HTTP codes returned by ODL
in create and update operations. It also modifies sendjson() because it
doesn't ignore any HTTP error code now.

Change-Id: Id0db2c0c1d8fddfbd16b3ce9476a2358e2ef1e49
Closes-Bug: #1369239

(8 comments)

almost lgtm, but I see one unpleasant moment - your reconnects everywhere in the code are *endless* - and as this error might also mean that connection was lost not only because we're choosing new master, but because there is no network connection, I'll propose to use 'max_retries' option from  'ceilometer.openstack.common.db.options', group="database" to reconnect some exact amount of time, not forever.'}, {'account_id': 10987, 'date': '2014-09-18 11:11:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Dina thanks for your comments.

Igor, I would say that's a micro bug, as this behaviour is not 100% predictable - if it'll be wrong max_retries set, it would be endless process :)"}, {'account_id': 3012, 'date': '2014-09-19 12:44:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10987, 'date': '2014-09-19 12:50:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3012, 'date': '2014-09-19 13:08:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8052, 'date': '2014-09-19 13:22:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

It's even defined in config help: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.db/blob/master/oslo/db/options.py#L84"}, {'account_id': 3012, 'date': '2014-09-19 13:26:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

- gate-tempest-dsvm-ceilometer-mongodb-full http://logs.openstack.org/87/122387/5/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-ceilometer-mongodb-full/7ffa99c : SUCCESS in 46m 34s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2014-09-22 08:39:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Thanks for this Igor.

I'm concerned though that the AutoReconnect is only being handled in the find case.

What happens if this same failure occurs on a map_reduce, find_and_modify, or insert call? Would we need to transparently retry in those cases also?

If so, I'm wondering would it be possible to make the change less intrusive by using a wrapper class approach? ... e.g. wrap a RetriableDB class, say, around self.db in the mongo storage driver. Then override __getattr__ on the wrapper to return another wrapper around the collection, which overrides the methods (find etc.) that need the transparent retry logic, and just passes through to the real collection otherwise.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 6676, 'date': '2014-09-22 08:58:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

agree to Eoghan Glynn'}, {'account_id': 10987, 'date': '2014-09-22 09:19:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@Eoghan Thank you for review. Your proposition is more fundamental, the question is if we really need it? 

While testing bug I primary mongodb node was stopped and operations with get, record and update functions were started, as a result I got exceptions only for operation with db.collection.find() function, other functions like insert or update went without any errors.

From MongoDB FAQ:
Primary and master nodes are the nodes that can accept writes.
By default, clients send all reads to the primary.

So if we don't need read operation we can use secondary nodes, while MongoDB elects new primary node from secondary ones."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2014-09-22 10:14:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi Igor, thanks for the quick response.

So my main concern is whether it's possible for an AutoReconnect to occur while a primary failover is in progress (or has just completed).

As noted on IRC just now, it seems like this could be the case on the basis of a quick search:

 <eglynn> here's an example of a retry pattern that accounts for AutoReconnect on insert ...
 <eglynn> http://www.arngarden.com/2013/04/29/handling-mongodb-autoreconnect-exceptions-in-python-using-a-proxy/
 <eglynn> also I notice in the pymongo tests there's a testcase that expects AutoReconnect on insert
 <eglynn> https://github.com/mongodb/mongo-python-driver/blob/master/test/high_availability/test_ha.py#L182
 <eglynn> so it doesn't really feel like AutoReconnect is limited to the find() case

Is there something different about our pymongo client usage pattern I wonder that would cause the AutoReconnect to only be seen on find()s?

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 10987, 'date': '2014-09-22 12:13:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi, Eoghan! Thank you for quick response and for links. 

In my experience I couldn't construct any scenarios to get exception or any error in insert or update operations when primary mongodb node was stopped, and at the same time find operation gave exception  AutoReconnect. In the tests the branche that tests AutoReconnect exception could be not achieved at all, if exception was not risen.

For my testing I used three node cluster with mongodb replica set on all nodes, and devstack on the master node. Connection was done as usual, so their was no any words about replica set, but in ceilometer.conf I have to add three IPs in connection string. Under these conditions I had no any problem with insert and update operations. I just want to guess where is in my simulation weak place? Probably I have missed something?

And other point may be somebody else could tests this bug?"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2014-09-22 14:52:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hi Igor,

I wonder is that just a timing issue, in the sense the inserts are relatively fast compared to query-constrained finds and are thus less likely to be in-flight at the critical juncture when the primary failover occurs?

One useful experiment might be to construct a slow map_reduce operation, in the form of a statistics query with a relatively wide time-range and then kill the primary while the MR is still on-going, to see how the failure is manifested.

In terms of the insertion, I did a super-quick experiment just now with a 3-member mongo replica set running on different ports on a single node (a fresh Fedora20 VM with no devstack, only a minimal set of mongo dependencies: mongodb-server 2.4.6 & pymongo 2.7.2).

I used an ultra-simple client first that creates a MongoReplicaSetClient and issues inserts in a tight loop. 

After killing the primary, this fails with:

  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/pymongo/collection.py", line 415, in insert
    self.uuid_subtype, client)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/pymongo/mongo_replica_set_client.py", line 1520, in _send_message
    raise AutoReconnect(str(why))
pymongo.errors.AutoReconnect: [Errno 111] Connection refused

If I change the client to use the standard MongoClient (i.e. without an explicit reference to the replicaSet, but instead with all 3 host:port pairs specified as a list passed to the client initializer) and again kill the new primary I see:

   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/pymongo/collection.py", line 415, in insert
    self.uuid_subtype, client)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/pymongo/mongo_client.py", line 1111, in _send_message
    sock_info = self.__socket(member)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/pymongo/mongo_client.py", line 919, in __socket
    "%s %s" % (host_details, str(why)))
pymongo.errors.AutoReconnect: could not connect to 127.0.0.1:27019: [Errno 111] Connection refused 

So  we see that AutoReconnect is indeed raised from inserts in that simple case. This would suggest that reason you're not seeing it is either timing-related or due to some difference in how the MongoClient is created by the ConnectionPool in the ceilometer case.
 
Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 7729, 'date': '2014-09-24 16:01:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3012, 'date': '2014-09-25 07:18:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

afair Igor is working now on the new version, let's wait it a little"}, {'account_id': 10987, 'date': '2014-09-29 12:05:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2014-09-29 12:22:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)

Thanks for this Igor, some further thoughts inline.

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-09-29 13:01:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified-1

commit_message:
[MongoDB] Fix bug with reconnection to new master node 

Fixes bug with raising AutoReconnect exception when MongoDB ReplicaSet
loses connection to primary node.

Change-Id: Id0e81ba60b28d09adff6a10d04b412f25257d8ce
Closes-Bug: #1309555

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded values

The directory path "/opt/stack/new" is spread across multiple
places in post_test_hook.sh and pre_test_hook.sh files, which
makes it difficult to edit those files in case the destination
directory is different.

Change-Id: Ic74058e6fe5d5876f3a48632b931c1eb8a16e179

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-29 12:10:20.000000000', 'message': "Logs page performance improvements

* Refactored logs handler to make performance testing easier
* Improved log reading performance by avoiding unnecessary strptime/strftime
  conversions (these functions are slow in Python)
* Removed 'All' button since it causes timeouts for large files
* Other small logs_tab.jsx fixes
* Removed truncate_log parameter -- all logs are now truncated and there's no
  'All' button
* Added 'from' and 'fetch_older' parameters -- this is to make truly
  incremental fetching of older log entries while keeping cache of file cursor
  position
* Added test case for fetch_older functionality

Change-Id: I9f4deec71499103f01dc0916c8e64aa83e06b084
Closes-Bug: #1384631
"}, {'created': '2014-10-29 12:44:32.000000000', 'message': "Logs page performance improvements

* Added 'from' and 'fetch_older' parameters -- this is to make truly

commit_message:
Logs page performance improvements

* Refactored logs handler to make performance testing easier
* Replaced read_backwards with a faster version that regexp-matches newlines
  instead of using slow rfind('\n')
* Improved log reading performance by avoiding unnecessary strptime/strftime
  conversions (these functions are slow in Python)
* Removed 'All' button since it causes timeouts for large files
* Other small logs_tab.jsx fixes
* Removed truncate_log parameter -- all logs are now truncated and there's no
  'All' button
* Added 'from' and 'fetch_older' parameters -- this is to make truly
  incremental fetching of older log entries while keeping cache of file cursor
  position
* Added test case for fetch_older functionality

Change-Id: I9f4deec71499103f01dc0916c8e64aa83e06b084
Closes-Bug: #1382489

commit_message:
Added structure for kilo specs

This commit adds a new template for kilo to sit separate from the juno
template. This will allow us to make changes to the template for the
kilo cycle without breaking the unit tests or having to edit all of the
juno specs (a future commit has a proposal for changes to the template).

At the time of posting this, there are no kilo specs in review, so now
would be the time to make changes to the kilo template without causing
headaches.

Change-Id: Id6fffeabcc1eb003adb479c234d3d7ee06dc3a76

commit_message:
Verify against per-release templates

Moving to per-release templates allows the template to change over
time, without requiring all old specs to be updated to match the new
template.

Change-Id: If29e039dab41bba8c4d39899a6ddf756e03eece6

test_types and test_utils test classes inherit from FunctionalTest
but don't use any of its functionality. They should be switched to
inheriting from TestCase.

Change-Id: I9f87b5c70e5e8fb7dd0e3e56d3b27054789389bf
"}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant FunctionalTest usage in API tests

test_types and test_utils test classes inherit from FunctionalTest
but don't use any of its functionality. They should be switched to
inheriting from TestCase.

Change-Id: I9f87b5c70e5e8fb7dd0e3e56d3b27054789389bf

commit_message:
Fix DevStack Ceph on the Giant release

As of the Ceph Giant release, pools 'data' and 'metadata' (used for
CephFS) were removed. Thus applying the pool change command fails on
Giant since those pools don't exist anymore. Now we are checking for
every release prior to Giant and apply proper commands accordingly.

Change-Id: Ia12042899c0e6809f5b98c2e0de177bb61c8a790
Signed-off-by: Sébastien Han <sebastien.han@enovance.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-11 06:31:48.000000000', 'message': 'Pass cwd when creating Packages.gz for deb

Creating Packages.gz with full path leads to corrupted
Filename attributes for every package, therefore apt wasnt
able to discover those packages

Example of Filename attribute:
 Filename: ./.build/repositories/ubuntu/glusterfs-server_3.5.2-4_amd64.deb

Related to blueprint cinder-neutron-plugins-in-fuel

Change-Id: Ie9699a92dd8bc53717b19e0d4b96df551d2e3b8d
'}]
commit_message:
Pass cwd when creating Packages.gz for deb

Creating Packages.gz with full path leads to corrupted
Filename attributes for every package, therefore apt wasnt
able to discover those packages

Example of Filename attribute:
 Filename: ./.build/repositories/ubuntu/glusterfs-server_3.5.2-4_amd64.deb

Related to blueprint cinder-neutron-plugins-in-fuel

Change-Id: Ie9699a92dd8bc53717b19e0d4b96df551d2e3b8d

ironic: use instance object for spawn

It will be better if we'll use `instance` like object.

commit_message:
Create subnet without gateway and explicit IP ver

Now it's impossible to create subnet without gateway in network
tests. This patch allows you to set gateway explicitly to None.
Backward compatibility is supported: by default it creates
subnet with default gateway as before. Also it adds possibility
to create subnet with specific IP version when you need to create
two subnets in one tenant of different IP version ("dual-stack").
Fixed attributes test for new requirements and added 2 anothers.

Change-Id: I7aca5e07be436f20cba90339785b46182d97fead

Add agent-child-processes-status blueprint

It was added for Juno, but didn't fully made it before
the feature freeze. Re-adding, with updated template
and implementation details.

commit_message:
Implementing the use of _L’x’/i18n markers

Placing the _Lx markers back into the code.  No other cleaner solution has
has been implemented. Patches will be submitted in a series of sub
directories and in a fashion that is manageable.
This is the fourth commit of this kind

Change-Id: I2b8a909b7f5aa38486371159a35b021a20fa6d9d
Partial-Bug: #1384312

commit_message:
Make updatable 2014.1.1-5.1 to 2014.1.1-5.1.1

We should be able to update (patch) 5.1 cluster to 5.1.1, since we're
supporting OpenStack patching feature (experimental).

Change-Id: Ic585ea7e3903b3f373432a171bc69ee6fef99df0
Closes-Bug: #1391194

commit_message:
Change default identity version to 3.

* Change default identity version in stackrc to v3

    Currently, the _get_target_portals_from_iscsiadm_output()
    method returns all of the iSCSI targets information.
    So nova-compute try to connect/disconnect all of the targets.

    Therefore, I have modifyed so that a suitable value
    might be extracted from the return value of this method when
    connecting/disconnecting a volume.

'}]
commit_message:
Fix multipath volume bug

    Currently, the _get_target_portals_from_iscsiadm_output()
    method returns all of the iSCSI targets information.
    So nova-compute try to connect/disconnect all of the targets.

    Therefore, I have modifyed so that a suitable value
    might be extracted from the return value of this method when
    connecting/disconnecting a volume.

    Change-Id: I38eafdaee03d136282cfde1fd013e322a4256cc4

Change-Id: I4b75c0200e163db60d69f4bf9d168382bd9f864f

commit_message:
Fix multipath volume bug

    Currently, the _get_target_portals_from_iscsiadm_output()
    method returns all of the iSCSI targets information.
    So nova-compute try to connect/disconnect all of the targets.

    Therefore, I have modifyed so that a suitable value
    might be extracted from the return value of this method when
    connecting/disconnecting a volume.

    Change-Id: I38eafdaee03d136282cfde1fd013e322a4256cc4

Change-Id: Ib8d5d5f7adb60caec83c084202e72b18e822c9fb

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-01 18:20:46.000000000', 'message': "Disable python-barbicanclient 3.0.0 version

python-barbicanclient 3.0.0 has introduced cliff module, but pins it
to 1.6.1, while global-requirements set it to >=1.7.0, now the whole
OpenStack projects depends on higher version of cliff, but
python-barbicanclient is needed by cinder, then grenade test will
fail because: pkg_resources.DistributionNotFound: cliff==1.6.1

As long as python-barbicanclient maintainers don't provide a patch
for 3.0.0 (which seems not happen FMPOV), we need to disbable this
version.

Change-Id: I02f055ae89989cef2bd0264c60279a1f1a141e01
Related-Bug: #1388414
"}]
commit_message:
Disable python-barbicanclient 3.0.0 version

python-barbicanclient 3.0.0 has introduced cliff module, but pins it
to 1.6.1, while global-requirements set it to >=1.7.0, now the whole
OpenStack projects depends on higher version of cliff, but
python-barbicanclient is needed by cinder, then grenade test will
fail because: pkg_resources.DistributionNotFound: cliff==1.6.1

As long as python-barbicanclient maintainers don't provide a patch
for 3.0.0 (which seems not happen FMPOV), we need to disbable this
version.

Change-Id: I02f055ae89989cef2bd0264c60279a1f1a141e01
Related-Bug: #1388414

[{'created': '2014-10-29 12:20:15.000000000', 'message': 'VM launch fails with Neutron, same secgroup name

Initially we were unable to boot a VM in admin
tenant using secgroup name same as that in
other tenant. Now, with this fix we are able
to boot a VM with the same scenario.

Closes-Bug : #1203413

Change-Id: I9a91ce3f235f786ac5b55daf8c450535a60075bd
'}]
commit_message:
VM launch fails with Neutron, same secgroup name

Initially we were unable to boot a VM in admin
tenant using secgroup name same as that in
other tenant. Now, with this fix we are able
to boot a VM with the same scenario.

Closes-Bug : #1203413

Change-Id: I9a91ce3f235f786ac5b55daf8c450535a60075bd

commit_message:
engine service add nested_depth to create_stack

Adds nested_depth as an optional argument to the top-level interface
for handling stack-creates, so it will be possible to specify the
depth when creating a nested stack via an RPC call between engines.

Change-Id: Idc24d1e55810b10615d764b94f7c708673516295
blueprint: decouple-nested

subject: Add nested_depth column to stack table

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-20 18:40:57.000000000', 'message': "Add nested_depth column to stack table

Adds a new nested_depth column, with a migration which traverses the
tree via owner_id for existing stacks and populates the appropriate depth.

This is a static, create-time depth, which should be sufficient for our
usage since nested stacks can never be moved within the tree.

The reason for this change is to allow depth validation (e.g enforcing
max_nested_stack_depth) when creating nested stacks via RPC calls,
without incurring the cost of loading every parent stack in the tree
to count the depth.  It may also allow some future optimisations of
some of the recently added API calls which do recursive introspection
considering a nested_depth parameter.

This is a step towards decoupling nested stacks from the current
usage of parent_resource and associated runtime introspection of the
parent stack, and as such the current StackResource is modified to
use the new scheme (required so post-migration we don't end up with
invalid nested_depth data in the DB).

Change-Id: I727651ff738ae668a3f21b374fc7a1b48f6e4777
blueprint: decouple-nested

max_nested_stack_depth) when creating nested stacks via RPC calls,
without incurring the cost of loading every parent stack in the tree
to count the depth.  It may also allow some future optimisations of
some of the recently added API calls which do recursive introspection
considering a nested_depth parameter.

This is a step towards decoupling nested stacks from the current
usage of parent_resource and associated runtime introspection of the
parent stack, and as such the current StackResource is modified to
use the new scheme (required so post-migration we don't end up with
invalid nested_depth data in the DB).

Change-Id: I727651ff738ae668a3f21b374fc7a1b48f6e4777

commit_message:
Add nested_depth column to stack table

Adds a new nested_depth column, with a migration which traverses the
tree via owner_id for existing stacks and populates the appropriate depth.

This is a static, create-time depth, which should be sufficient for our
usage since nested stacks can never be moved within the tree.

The reason for this change is to allow depth validation (e.g enforcing
max_nested_stack_depth) when creating nested stacks via RPC calls,
without incurring the cost of loading every parent stack in the tree
to count the depth.  It may also allow some future optimisations of
some of the recently added API calls which do recursive introspection
considering a nested_depth parameter.

This is a step towards decoupling nested stacks from the current
usage of parent_resource and associated runtime introspection of the
parent stack, and as such the current StackResource is modified to
use the new scheme (required so post-migration we don't end up with
invalid nested_depth data in the DB).

Change-Id: I727651ff738ae668a3f21b374fc7a1b48f6e4777
blueprint: decouple-nested

commit_message:
DB: Only ask for MAC instead of entire port

Optimize a query in _get_lla_gateway_ip_for_subnet
to only grab the column used instead of every column
in the port table.

Partial-Bug: #1373851
Change-Id: I5257e1e22645f3df9a77c0967b09a0ad0cf8b251
(cherry picked from commit 60dd689183469d2958d6dcb60d93a8d94ef694d1)

MySQL users can now now 'privilege' property associated with them,
allow for managing users with lower than ALL privileges.

Change-Id: Id647c5f0cf169f9c907cf9e9dfca16e05c796257
"}]
commit_message:
Support custom privileges for managed MySQL users

MySQL users can now now 'privilege' property associated with them,
allow for managing users with lower than ALL privileges.

Change-Id: Id647c5f0cf169f9c907cf9e9dfca16e05c796257

commit_message:
Mention dib-utils package in sample instructions

dib-utils has moved to its own package, and needs to be installed as
part of a minimal usage of diskimage-builder

'}, {'created': '2014-08-26 05:03:24.000000000', 'message': "Make deploy-ci-overcloud script configurable

Pulls almost all values in from the json env files. Left alone a few
exceptions that I don't see us actually needing to configure at this
point.

Aside from setting the region name to hp1, this script contains no
hardcoded defaults - it assumes that the hp1 config files will be around
to provide the values for that region.

commit_message:
Make deploy-ci-overcloud script configurable

Pulls almost all values in from the json env files. Left alone a few
exceptions that I don't see us actually needing to configure at this
point.

Aside from setting the region name to hp1, this script contains no
hardcoded defaults - it assumes that the hp1 config files will be around
to provide the values for that region.

Change-Id: Ie5876222dbd01e18a7e81aa1c3cb92407b9206ed

commit_message:
Remove deprecated vconfig support

This removes the deprecated vconfig support which I'm not sure
ever worked properly to begin with. The
neutron.ovs.public_interface_raw_device heat metadata parameter
can also be removed since it is no longer used for anything.

Once this lands we should follow up and land a Heat templates
patch to remove the neutron.ovs.public_interface_raw_device
parameter there as well. I've filed this bug to track that:

Partial-bug: #1386910

Change-Id: Ia712d5e5d6de4aa41857b12a8d218dd9ec41be61

commit_message:
OS::Nova::Server rich network property

Allowing port and floating IP association properties to be specified within a
OS::Nova::Server works around issues with nova port management, provides
users with a simpler way of implementing a common pattern, and allows more
templates to be neutron/nova-networking agnostic.

Change-Id: Icd7ab189b09cba92065e3235bd38a038f55bea7f
Specifies: bp rich-network-prop

commit_message:
Use Zaqar for software-config metadata and signaling

Zaqar provides a simple messaging service which allows heat and orchestrated
services to efficiently communicate with each other, which make it ideal for
software-config metadata distribution and signaling

Change-Id: Ie6fdf42670a79e8e0b0a8e433819ac92e6a1658f

commit_message:
Activate pep8 check that _ is imported

Removed the specification in tox.ini that _ is a builtin so that
it will no longer assume that _ does not need to be imported.

The correct import is:

    from cinder.i18n import _

Activating this check did not flag any violations in cinder.

Change-Id: Ifc789514d2462c059eb9f003fac288e751331ded

[{'created': '2014-11-07 14:30:27.000000000', 'message': "Retry remove iscsi target

There is a race in the gate when removing an iscsi
target in the remove export flow where the target
is still active. It's about a 75% failure rate so
simply adding a configurable retry on the delete

commit_message:
Retry remove iscsi target

There is a race in the gate when removing an iscsi
target in the remove export flow where the target
is still active. It's about a 75% failure rate so
simply adding a configurable retry on the delete
call should clean that up.

Change-Id: I8531652e8b80f1c65c9942e109dea01fda5674e0
Closes-Bug: #1363258

is this change backwards compatible? Will this work with keystone v2 instances?

Just one doubt :)'}, {'account_id': 2799, 'date': '2014-09-16 10:39:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Flavio,

I'm using v2 - so that in itself suggests it'll work with v2 ;) (At present it doesn't work on the latest glanceclient from pip - 0.14.0, but will work in 0.13.1 which is after the v3 patch went in)
But - looking at get_endpoint() in the keystoneclient auth/base.py it accepts the key of "interface" and not "endpoint_type", which is why this doesn't work until you adjust the glanceclient code to pass "interface" instead of "endpoint_type".'}, {'account_id': 2799, 'date': '2014-09-16 10:40:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fix to ensure endpoint_type is used by _get_endpoint()

* ks_session get_endpoint uses "interface" instead of "endpoint_type"

Change-Id: I59e45423703774f6dc26c96644f83083832b0627

commit_message:
Set vif_details to reflect enable_security_group

While plugging vif, VIFDriver in Nova follows "ovs_hybrid_plug" and
"port_filter" in "binding:vif_detail" which is passed from Neutron, but
those are always true.  This patch make ML2 OVS mech driver set those
param depends on enable_security_group flag.  It enables users to avoid
ovs_hybrid plugging.

This patch also fixes the same issue in the following plugins/drivers:
  * NEC Plugin
  * BigSwitch Plugin
  * Ryu Plugin
  * ML2 Plugin - OFAgent Mech Driver

Closes-Bug: #1336624
Change-Id: I2b7fb526a6f1b730ad65289307b24fd28b996e1b
(cherry picked from commit e73f8da072cb41559ecee7f29f864a10db475444)

commit_message:
Enable assignment-from-no-return pylint check

The @versioning.versioned decorator used (only) in
plugins.vmware.nsxlib.router completely confuses this check, so add a
file-local pylint disable.

Change-Id: I2a79a643a982f49faaf22b88764cb170ef89ce21

commit_message:
Enabled Cisco ML2 driver to use new upstream ncclient

The code is still able to handle the old, custom ncclient that
we used before. It uses the different function signatures
for the ncclient's connect() function to detect which version
is installed.

Change-Id: I09d81b424d86f4cd35ca048507f06471246b91d8
Closes-Bug: 1352635
(cherry picked from commit 74c99fb40d4621c6c0915764537dfb54cc6519ca)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2014-11-08 20:21:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Revamp of customizing dashboard page

Revamped the layout of this page to make it easier to read.
Added section on how to customize the help url.
General tidy up

Change-Id: I600208ab8c585977a43cf28dff3e6109aae231e1
Closes-bug: #1390791

commit_message:
Always using domain id to create domain project or user

Add a function to get domain id from a domain name,
and use domain id to create domain project or user.

Change-Id: Ie97c179e62311406201476c0d4c43a731c48908c
Partial-Bug: #1376213

(2 comments)

I'd prefer that services not be prefixed by openstack, but otherwise I think this is fine. I don't really understand the response given, so I'd appreciate a clearer response: will source based installs change service names? If so that is breaking backward compatibility without a deprecation notice."}, {'account_id': 8532, 'date': '2014-11-10 19:35:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm sure you understand I have no control over the actual service names used in packages.

No, this doesn't affect source installs negatively or any differently than map-services does.  While svc-map is a different implementation, it doesn't do anything different than map-services, it only decouples."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2014-11-10 19:44:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks Ryan. Looks good then!'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2014-11-10 19:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2014-10-20 18:25:36.000000000', 'message': 'Migrates glance element from map-services to svc-map

This patch migrates the glance element from map-services
to svc-map by adding a svc-map file and adding the -a option to
os-svc-enable.

Change-Id: I5e5b57d18a8e0923f95296e036c818c44323a017
'}]
commit_message:
Migrates glance element from map-services to svc-map

This patch migrates the glance element from map-services
to svc-map by adding a svc-map file and adding the -a option to
os-svc-enable.

Change-Id: I5e5b57d18a8e0923f95296e036c818c44323a017

agree on migration... my other concern is that to me, there's just as much ambiguity saying network.traffic... when i hear bandwidth, i think of B/s... when i hear traffic i think gauge type value...

is there a consensus on terminology in community? just so we avoid making this change and another person starts wondering 'this should really be bandwidth'"}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2014-07-22 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

gordon, thanks for the review. 

1. I do agree we need a migration, but it's a metric name migration and seems we never did that. It means we need to write migration script for each database type. Right? I assume yes :(

2. I think your intuition correct and I believe most of the community guys have the same feeling about the difference about 'bandwidth'/'traffic'. But yep, I'd like to get more comments about this. Or maybe I should sent a note to mail list."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2014-08-01 22:31:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Rename bandwidth to network.traffic

Based on current implement, we are using "bandwidth" for the
data collected from neutron metering agent. But actually,
the data is the data amount transferred in a period. In other
words, the metric is the traffic instead of bandwidth. This
patch will rename it and fill the document gap.

Change-Id: I57bfa9e6459f6f39fd92692f82737d7e9cff5fee
Closes-Bug: 1339636

commit_message:
Set vif_details to reflect enable_security_group

While plugging vif, VIFDriver in Nova follows "ovs_hybrid_plug" and
"port_filter" in "binding:vif_detail" which is passed from Neutron, but
those are always true.  This patch make ML2 OVS mech driver set those
param depends on enable_security_group flag.  It enables users to avoid
ovs_hybrid plugging.

This patch also fixes the same issue in the following plugins/drivers:
  * NEC Plugin
  * BigSwitch Plugin
  * Ryu Plugin
  * ML2 Plugin - OFAgent Mech Driver

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/ml2/drivers/test_ofagent_mech.py

Closes-Bug: #1336624
Change-Id: I2b7fb526a6f1b730ad65289307b24fd28b996e1b
(cherry picked from commit e73f8da072cb41559ecee7f29f864a10db475444)

commit_message:
Allow to add router interface to IPv6 SLAAC network

This patch will allow an IPv6 subnet configured with SLAAC
(or dhcpv6-stateless) to be attached to a router interface.

Closes-Bug: #1382076
Change-Id: If0c48a7287a828eef4a0f0b0859d4f898d2937bd
(cherry picked from commit 95accb535017f1384b38b12eb78f0e58287d8e08)

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-10 13:09:57.000000000', 'message': 'allow delete_port to work when there are multiple floating ips

It is possible to associate multiple floating ip addresses with a single
port through the use of multiple *fixed* ip addresses, e.g.:

    nova boot ... --nic net-id=my-net-id myserver
    nova add-fixed-ip myserver my-net-id
    nova add-floating-ip --fixed-address x.x.x.1 myserver y.y.y.y.1
    nova add-floating-ip --fixed-address x.x.x.2 myserver y.y.y.y.2

In this situation, neutron.db.l3_db.disassociate_floatingips would throw
an exception:

    Exception: Multiple floating IPs found for port <port-id>

This would prevent someone from deleting an instance that was associated
with multiple floating ips.

This patch corrects disassociate_floatingips so that it will
disassociate all floating ips associated with the port, allowing the
delete operation to proceed correctly.

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/l3_db.py

Change-Id: I68a2131fa8ee80828354c9db4ac405c3f77c3b90
Closes-bug: 1302701
(cherry picked from commit bad87ce76ad27f2a4b3c72e26e2eccc2c9564b85)
'}]
commit_message:
allow delete_port to work when there are multiple floating ips

It is possible to associate multiple floating ip addresses with a single
port through the use of multiple *fixed* ip addresses, e.g.:

    nova boot ... --nic net-id=my-net-id myserver
    nova add-fixed-ip myserver my-net-id
    nova add-floating-ip --fixed-address x.x.x.1 myserver y.y.y.y.1
    nova add-floating-ip --fixed-address x.x.x.2 myserver y.y.y.y.2

In this situation, neutron.db.l3_db.disassociate_floatingips would throw
an exception:

    Exception: Multiple floating IPs found for port <port-id>

This would prevent someone from deleting an instance that was associated
with multiple floating ips.

This patch corrects disassociate_floatingips so that it will
disassociate all floating ips associated with the port, allowing the
delete operation to proceed correctly.

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/l3_db.py

Change-Id: I68a2131fa8ee80828354c9db4ac405c3f77c3b90
Closes-bug: 1302701
(cherry picked from commit bad87ce76ad27f2a4b3c72e26e2eccc2c9564b85)

[{'created': '2014-10-23 04:32:19.000000000', 'message': 'NEC plugin: Allow to apply Packet filter on OFC router interface

Config parameter support_packet_filter_on_ofc_router is added
only to make the pluign work with the old version of PFC v5
which has no support of packet filter on vrouter interface.

Closes-Bug: #1384263
Change-Id: I2f54419e0b7c84c554ab2039ebaebdb065f9e502
'}]
commit_message:
NEC plugin: Allow to apply Packet filter on OFC router interface

Config parameter support_packet_filter_on_ofc_router is added
only to make the pluign work with the old version of PFC v5
which has no support of packet filter on vrouter interface.

Closes-Bug: #1384263
Change-Id: I2f54419e0b7c84c554ab2039ebaebdb065f9e502

commit_message:
Add assertion to test_page_reverse method

In neutron/tests/unit/test_api_v2.APIv2TestCase.test_page_reverse
there is no second call to test_case with 'page_reverse': 'False,
because of use assert_called_once_with.
In proposed change before second testcase, reset_mock is called.
Remove also second 'instance' initialization.

Closes-Bug: #1373126
Change-Id: I552b7b47456a1cdfccdeb8d7853ec3395317097a

commit_message:
Revert "Deletes floating ip related connection states"

This reverts commit 3a30d19e4e2e5bf4f54045561158661b43beecb3.

The change pulled in a new runtime dependency on conntrack-tools
that was not present in previous Icehouse releases. Leaving the
patch applied in the branch means that all distributions are
either forced to ship the new package and its dependencies in
their repositories, or patch out the fix. Also, running
conntrack in network namespaces can be problematic on some of
platforms with old kernels (like RHEL6).

Change-Id: I0cb896d5bef9982cb862a195ec4010f62bded39c

'}, {'created': '2014-11-06 08:32:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Wrong Product ID for Intel NIC example

The current product ID belongs to the PF product,

Change-Id: I87291ea0458fa1ef7df1c06e17b7f9071ffb39e0

commit_message:
SRIOV: Fix Wrong Product ID for Intel NIC example

Some Examples and default Values of the Product ID for Intel NIC contains
Wrong Product ID that belongs to the PF product,
it should be replaced with the product ID of the VF.

Change-Id: I87291ea0458fa1ef7df1c06e17b7f9071ffb39e0
Closes-Bug: 1387152

commit_message:
Fix L3 HA network creation to allow user to create router

Update HA Network creation to use an admin context to allow Neutron
to create the tenant-less network required for the HA router when
it does not yet exist and is being created by a non-admin user.

Neutron creates these resources without a tenant so users cannot see
or modify the HA network, ports, etc.  Port creation and association
already use elivated admin contexts to allow their function when
an user attempts to create a HA L3 router.

Change-Id: I36166158a0970b8d08d6702054b11a43fb684281
Closes-Bug: #1388716

commit_message:
Fixed a bug in Nova driver

Nova driver was expecting a dictionary, however it seems sometimes it is a string.

This fix checked if it is not a dictionary and convert the string if needed

Change-Id: If23f64ac5369e56c8717e89c81b33c7433affabf

(3 comments)

It would be nice if we could turn persistence on and off.  I'd like to be able to do it both programmatically (for testing) and via the congress.conf file.

I don't see any tests of persistence here.  I imagine we'd want tests that try to get the policy engine and the DB out of sync.  So try inserting rules with different kinds of errors and ensuring that the DB does not accept any of them."}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2014-10-14 12:28:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Start persisting data to database

Previously, congress would store its policy rules in memory and if you
restarted the server you would loose all your data. Now all the data is
persisted to a db and rules are loaded from it on restart.

Change-Id: I65b726f6ef731db9a83ce9b754f85a3726fa4f49

subject: Add persistant store for api

commit_message:
Add persistant store for api

This patch adds the framework necessary for data passed in through
the api to be persisted. This patch leverages alembic which provides
several different interfaces for us to handle schema changes. This patch
also adds the initial schema for the policy_rules table which will hold
policy rule data.

Note: lots of this code was shamelessly stolen from neutron :)

Implements blueprint persistent-storage-for-api

Change-Id: I7c85f94cd4c77703debd51d101f221ec33274346

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-24 08:16:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix add_dependencies for floating_ip resource

The cause of problem is related with tricky method of Dependencies
class. So required_by method returns dictionary with resources which
have current resource in dependency. In the same time port resource
does not require floating ip, contrariwise floating ip require port.
As result required_by will not return depended port. There is one
way to solve issue: use dictionary of requires resources.

Also this patch fixes missed code error with incorrect using properties
attribute for value fixed_ip.

Notice that both these issues were not detected, because:
 - method port_on_subnet is not executed, because required_by was always
   empty dictionary.
 - current test has shadow mistake. Dependencies for router_interface
   always contain FloatingIP resource, because router gateway also was
   presented in using templates and during creation graph FloatingIp
   automatically was added to result dictionary.

Change-Id: Ida30e51d526a3f5d2a4d0a4102b1036f1c518302
Closes-Bug: #1384114
(cherry picked from commit 29dbe697516e3e5dd38a926b76f623661cbce020)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix add_dependencies for floating_ip resource

The cause of problem is related with tricky method of Dependencies
class. So required_by method returns dictionary with resources which
have current resource in dependency. In the same time port resource
does not require floating ip, contrariwise floating ip require port.
As result required_by will not return depended port. There is one
way to solve issue: use dictionary of requires resources.

Also this patch fixes missed code error with incorrect using properties
attribute for value fixed_ip.

Notice that both these issues were not detected, because:
 - method port_on_subnet is not executed, because required_by was always
   empty dictionary.
 - current test has shadow mistake. Dependencies for router_interface
   always contain FloatingIP resource, because router gateway also was
   presented in using templates and during creation graph FloatingIp
   automatically was added to result dictionary.

Change-Id: Ida30e51d526a3f5d2a4d0a4102b1036f1c518302
Closes-Bug: #1384114
(cherry picked from commit 29dbe697516e3e5dd38a926b76f623661cbce020)

The requirement is Apache licensed, so that's good.

The version number 0.1.0 indicates that the API might be subject to change, but the code hasn't been updated in several months. Do you know when the library authors intend to stabilize the API?"}, {'account_id': 9315, 'date': '2014-10-14 12:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

Thanks for the review. We are the authors of the library also.  The current API available in the library is stable and new API might be added in the future for more functionalities.  We need module 0.1.0 for the drivers in Juno release of Ironic.'}, {'account_id': 9315, 'date': '2014-10-14 12:50:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-10-14 14:01:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Add proliantutils dependency for Ironic

This module is required in Ironic project for proliant hardware
due to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/89500/.

Starting with python-openstackclient we're intending to add this to the
client libraries. Add it here so that this is possible.

Change-Id: I801eb38114eb2fe5c773094fae6b8e20c99dfec5
"}]
commit_message:
Add os-client-config

Starting with python-openstackclient we're intending to add this to the
client libraries. Add it here so that this is possible.

Change-Id: I801eb38114eb2fe5c773094fae6b8e20c99dfec5

commit_message:
Enable Python 3.4 enum in Neutron

Define enum validation as part of the REST
validation framework. Adding fisrt usage
in validation framework: vip.protocol

Change-Id: Ia5802d24a5aaa63db95d242d586311c1399eccf0
Implements: blueprint using-python-enum

A general comment: users are allowed to enter --extra-dhcp-opt in the port-create command, and --dns-nameserver in the subnet-create command. commit_message:
Add support to DHCP agent for BP ipv6-two-attributes

Implements: blueprint dnsmasq-ipv6-slaac
Implements: blueprint dnsmasq-ipv6-dhcpv6-stateful
Implements: blueprint dnsmasq-ipv6-dhcpv6-stateless
Implements: blueprint dnsmasq-bind-into-qrouter-namespace

Change-Id: I5a0f2a696cd7a3ec59d0ece375a7a658e1853032

[{'account_id': 11737, 'date': '2014-11-06 14:04:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11737, 'date': '2014-11-06 14:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I chose this approach to fixing the issue because the get_volume() function is used in two places:
 1 - __init__() of LVM object, when trying to determine whether a thin-provisionning pool should be created or not
 2 - create_lv_snapshot() of LVM object, when trying to retrieve some additional information on the source logical volume

In both cases, the get_volume() function is expected to return None if the logical volume does not exist. This method was the least intrusive, and the most flexible I could think of.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-06 15:11:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

commit_message:
Fix the LV NotFound situation for thin-type LVM

If the logical volume is not found, LVM displays on the error output
that the volumes could not be found. So here, we filter on this very
specific situation, and let all the other cases go through the stack.

Added a test for this new code path, which raises an exception of the
proper type to be caught by the new code.

Change-Id: I703af8ccd87c6332d9f88eff63fcf26ebed234f4
Closes-Bug: #1390081

commit_message:
Add an example for the connection class

Also, change around the other examples to use the connection
example so there isn't duplication of code for session and
authentication.

Change-Id: I90dbcfac3eae0c792bd9c4eae071de7d81e1b27d

commit_message:
Add check for NULL in where clause to get_alarm_definition method

Snip alarm definition id from uri before creating link in JSON return body.

Change-Id: I6c93fe5089999b850de3d6c098100abc5094d8a0

[{'created': '2014-10-30 05:47:52.000000000', 'message': 'Adds Kilo template back into toctree

We have previously published the kilo template here:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/kilo-template.html
and have since updated it. But because we removed it from the toctree
it is not being updated on the website.

This change adds just the kilo template back into the toctree.

Change-Id: I8bdaef79439bf2f49a979c16de22c7aa6d7e2fcb
'}]
commit_message:
Adds Kilo template back into toctree

We have previously published the kilo template here:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/kilo-template.html
and have since updated it. But because we removed it from the toctree
it is not being updated on the website.

This change adds just the kilo template back into the toctree.

Change-Id: I8bdaef79439bf2f49a979c16de22c7aa6d7e2fcb

commit_message:
libvirt: add classes for NUMA memory binding configuration

To allow specification of strict memory binding for NUMA
nodes, add support for libvirt's <numatune> XML element.

Related-bug: #1385308
Change-Id: I08f01a50b92ca648b803f94ef028bc2f10e6f6a8

and replaces it with the debian nodejs-legacy package which

Change-Id: Ifbe915a019f0360740932989a6885c972ce6fd65

commit_message:
Updated use of nodejs packages.

This patch removes the manual creation of the nodejs symlink,
and replaces it with the debian nodejs-legacy package which
does exactly the same thing, except better.

Change-Id: Ifbe915a019f0360740932989a6885c972ce6fd65

Drop newlibvirt job

This job isn't working and I've since switched gears towards working
on a CentOS based solution.

commit_message:
Need to pass the ca-file arg to keystone, too

This allows the authentication of the keystone server certificate.
However, keystone calls the argument cacert

Change the argument ca-file to be os-cacert to be more consistent
with keystone and other CLIs

Change-Id: I77bbc8efb2d8237dd104acc8a13319d28748075b

commit_message:
configuration parameters payload changed

the configuration parameters payload was originally just 'max'
and 'min' for the range and was changed to 'max_value' and
'min_value' in the output. Reverting this back to the original
v1 spec of 'max' and 'min'.

Closes-Bug: #1390317
Change-Id: I9628313e4154048a6aa9a089a6e3ec18f9af1d33

commit_message:
Was sending out an extra AlarmCreatedEvent for SubAlarm event

Only need to send these when the alarm is created, not when another
metric is added

Change-Id: I8df37c9f81a768a16db6daec9c7e67b4ecfe0d1c

[{'created': '2014-11-04 09:40:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Horizon crash when parsing volume list including a volume without name.
If using Nova CLI to create a new volume (without name) that is used to boot a new VM,
then Horizon will be crashed when the volume list is retrieved by clicking the tab
"Volumes" on Horizon dashboard.
The Nova CLI used is: nova boot ... --block-device ...

Change-Id: I9850dca2f6f5ab8eebab035f9e7cf19d7262f7d2
Closes-Bug: #1389108

commit_message:
Fix Horizon crash when parsing volume list

If using Nova or Cinder CLI to create a new volume
(without name) that can be used to boot a new VM,
then Horizon will be crashed when the volume list
is retrieved by clicking the tab "Volumes" on
Horizon dashboard.

Change-Id: I9850dca2f6f5ab8eebab035f9e7cf19d7262f7d2
Closes-Bug: #1389108

commit_message:
Revert "Pin nova"

I7eb06d70aba99592152559252fb2bf2058dc39c6.

commit_message:
Restyled topbar to resemble UX guidelines

Also moved topbar styling into separate component
Adjusted context selection to match other dropdowns, merged it with topbar styles file

Partially-Implements: blueprint css-breakdown
Partially-Implements: blueprint navigation-styling
Change-Id: If30b85f5415a3e8d0416fdafeb233b722feb014f

commit_message:
Updating agent keystone authentication

Updated the agent to obtain a project scoped token from Keystone.
Fixed an issue with the open_file_descriptors_perc calculation in collector.

Change-Id: Ibfe68f73cd53622c76835939aa93f85cd27a2791

commit_message:
Remove validate_location

As part of the fix for bug 1334196 Glance no longer uses the
'validate_location' function. (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/107383/)

It can be removed from the store.

Change-Id: Ib45f2d5d04bf28b8dfe9c5e879f910514f330950

commit_message:
Add --or-show option to user create

The --or-show option is added to create commands for the common case
of needing to ensure an object exists and getting its properties if
it does or creating a new one if it does not exist.

Note that if the object exists, any additional options that would
set values in a newly created object are ignored if the object
exists.

FakeResource needs the __name__ attribute to fall through utils.find_resource.

Prove the concept on v2 user create then propogate once we're happy with it...

Change-Id: I6268566514840c284e6a1d44b409a81d6699ef99

commit_message:
Move cinder store to use auth_token

The cinder store uses auth_tok. This should be
changed to use auth_token as the glance request
context is changing: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/131478/

Change-Id: Id8a920d7035de111ce3fde54d62f35a07a9a7851
Partial-bug: #1385213

commit_message:
Replace custom lazy loading by stevedore

Now we have own implementation for loading
extensions. stevedore avoids creating yet
another extension mechanism by building on
top of setuptools entry points.

Change-Id: I7fcb981b58b20fb49d10eea3d477f962e4bf3565

commit_message:
Swift content enhancements and fixes

I updated the swift content in the installation guide with a
few enhancements and fixes as follows:

1) Improved wording/phrasing (thanks Joe Robinson).
2) Improved consistency of duplicate content.
3) Added example output from ring builder commands.
4) Addressed other minor issues.

Change-Id: I14b6f07877677b3c1b38271150e7c39d19c2c96f
Partial-Bug: #1389382
backport: juno
(cherry picked from commit 2c139a4994c9444d5f6ca611215a2d05d54adb10)

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-01 19:59:26.000000000', 'message': "Add resource CRUD to connection class

Once a user has a resource, there is no need to use the proxy
to perform operations on it.  These CRUD methods allow the user
to perform them direction on the object.  For instance:

    project = conn.identity.find_project('foo')
    project['enabled'] = False
    conn.update(project)

Change-Id: I801de6b56f2f44c568b6edcf9c1429014f42a65f
"}]
commit_message:
Add resource CRUD to connection class

Once a user has a resource, there is no need to use the proxy
to perform operations on it.  These CRUD methods allow the user
to perform them direction on the object.  For instance:

    project = conn.identity.find_project('foo')
    project['enabled'] = False
    conn.update(project)

Change-Id: I801de6b56f2f44c568b6edcf9c1429014f42a65f

commit_message:
Switch to current options in nova.conf

Switch some nova.conf options to the most current name/group,
the old names were deprecated in nova in Juno and have now
been removed.
Closes-Bug: #1390427

Change-Id: I7eb06d70aba99592152559252fb2bf2058dc39c6

[{'created': '2014-10-31 16:05:36.000000000', 'message': 'Use a default for controller VIP

Having a parameter for the default VIP simplifies the configuration and
reduces repetition of slightly more complex code. This method also
allows you to easily override the VIP and pin to a certain host if ever
required.

Change-Id: I878bd3787f2f3f0fba188a2d1fc96da1abf13a15
'}]
commit_message:
Use a default for controller VIP

Having a parameter for the default VIP simplifies the configuration and
reduces repetition of slightly more complex code. This method also
allows you to easily override the VIP and pin to a certain host if ever
required.

Change-Id: I878bd3787f2f3f0fba188a2d1fc96da1abf13a15

commit_message:
Use param for database hosts

Use a parameter with description for database host selection rather than
a reference variable. This simplifies template and also allows the
database host addresses to be overridden and passed in.

Change-Id: I3d695a673ff1c350e0d90bd6dd3e7b25cb1d98c9

commit_message:
Add check-ssl option to HAProxy checks

To allow HAProxy to correctly detect if a service is running it needs to
be told when to use TLS/SSL for its checks.

Change-Id: I41749b13779a2349e065465412ec8346f1d9384d

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-30 13:53:32.000000000', 'message': 'Install test-requirements before sudo is removed

When `post_test_hook` is called, sudo previledges had been removed
already. Since this job needs to install test-requirements to run, this
patch is moving the install of these requirements to the
`pre_test_hook`.

This could also be achieved by creating a virtual environment and then
installing everything there but that means we would be installing
zaqarclient twice, which is not the ideal thing to do.

Change-Id: I7f22966cf24942f6e4fc14e49b366f8dd7d55a7e
'}]
commit_message:
Install test-requirements before sudo is removed

When `post_test_hook` is called, sudo previledges had been removed
already. Since this job needs to install test-requirements to run, this
patch is moving the install of these requirements to the
`pre_test_hook`.

This could also be achieved by creating a virtual environment and then
installing everything there but that means we would be installing
zaqarclient twice, which is not the ideal thing to do.

Change-Id: I7f22966cf24942f6e4fc14e49b366f8dd7d55a7e

commit_message:
Revert pcs provider fixes

* Revert "Refactor Heat HA to wrappers"
This reverts commit 11cb026a46ec14e32091ef528e29f0fed8eddf89.
*Revert "New service provider"
This reverts commit 4835c10d78ea7379cf26c0c868b4e9d49724eed1.
* Revert "Use separate pid files for Pacemaker OCF"
This reverts commit e3978df939af8f622a681881c787fa1d8e349e69.
* Revert "Remove old basic service_disables"
This reverts commit a334d105d86645d2bb32f0af75f8ea70c4c1aa48.

Closes-bug: #1390745

Change-Id: I1214348115a553c73127fc7b7e36e534075213a4

commit_message:
Auth policy support implementation

* Added policy oslo module
* Added related config options to sample file
* Enabled policy enforcement for all API calls
* Changed error rendering for access violations

Implements blueprint: auth-policy

Change-Id: Idb27eb052b1f598c3cb688bae1debcaaebe13aa5

Remove obsolete parameters

* Config file contained parameters, that ubused anymore.
* Sample config validation was not added to the pep8 check

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-10 11:30:13.000000000', 'message': "Install lsb_release from package

The URL we were using to download lsb_release from no longer works,
install from package so this is not affected by disappearing URL's
in future.

This was originally installed from a URL because the package dependencies
caused a 87M increase in the size of the base image. For fedora the
increase is now 27M which is a little more tolerable.

Change-Id: I6e56a4a81786b33c5c6b92df2bd8236cd3f19670
"}]
commit_message:
Install lsb_release from package

The URL we were using to download lsb_release from no longer works,
install from package so this is not affected by disappearing URL's
in future.

This was originally installed from a URL because the package dependencies
caused a 87M increase in the size of the base image. For fedora the
increase is now 27M which is a little more tolerable.

Change-Id: I6e56a4a81786b33c5c6b92df2bd8236cd3f19670

would be interested in the justification for this'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2014-10-24 03:25:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Maintenance: 
Can more modularly maintain releases. We'd remove grizzly to havana next release for example.
Contributions:
Potential for easier upstream contribution from others maintaining upgrade guides as separate manuals for their own distro.
Findability:
People aren't finding this chapter due to being a level deep in the Ops Guide."}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2014-10-24 03:41:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

I'm sorry, I don't think that is an adequate justification - please post the plans on the mailing list and we can discuss."}, {'account_id': 9515, 'date': '2014-10-24 03:52:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Findability: We don't make the upgrade procedures very obvious. Lately, people seem to try the installation guide and fail.

Maintenance/Contributions: The size and structure of the Ops Guide isn't friendly to new (or seasoned) contributors. In particular, use of variable lists doesn't handle the procedural nature of upgrades.

Also, I'd like to see upgrades become more topic-based and this is a step in the right direction."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2014-11-10 16:43:14.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Adds content for new Upgrade Guide

- Matches captalization of OpenStack style rather than O'Reilly style.
- Covers grizzly to havana and havana to icehouse on RHEL and Ubuntu.

Change-Id: Ia9974fb24c4b2874d685c3404ba9c72c7d13e040

(1 comment)

I'm almost a -2 on this one because the implied need for the logical state to be nearly empty.  Seems like Heat or another orchestration tool would enable the same desired outcome of a repeatable logical network configuration in another tenant.  Additionally, switching the ownership is not a trivial operation as there are many underlying items which much be moved and validated too.  Some of those items cannot be moved if they are shared so what would be desired operation? shallow/deep copy?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-05-22 19:55:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Verified

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 8124, 'date': '2014-05-22 19:55:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I share Mark point of view.
If you can not transfer VMs ownership, this behavior can be emulated using Heat/Ansible/YA-deploiement-tool without developing a tricky feature which could be a security hole source and let objects associated to the transferred in incoherent states.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-05-22 19:59:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

commit_message:
Transfer Network Ownership

I would like to propose that Networks are able to be transfered to another
project updating it's tenant_id field from the API mentioned above.

Implements: Blueprint transfer-network-ownership
Change-Id: I7ee9b2cda6d5422a8ca0186c4fdaf16233a7e462

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 5892, 'date': '2014-06-11 23:23:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2014-06-11 23:25:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

commit_message:
Add hacking check for vim configuration in source files

This patch  does the following:
* adds hacking check [H321] for vim configuration in source files
* add tests for hacking checks for vim configuration in source files

Change-Id: Ib8af22f8ed07446c6b23d8a64c30cefa4e7d290a
Partial-Bug: #1229324

subject: Add hacking check for editor configuration in source files

commit_message:
Add hacking check for editor configuration in source files

This patch  does the following:
* adds hacking check [H105] for editor configuration in source files
* add tests for hacking checks for editor configuration in source files
* current editor checks supported: vim, emacs.

Change-Id: I17d5db7fcf8071da6b00c11e62e9ef36d8e28448
Closes-Bug: #1333359

commit_message:
Redis: for non-strict Redis class, expired ttl is None, not -1

Python bindings for Redis return None if ttl is expired instead of -1
when Redis class is used (instead of StrictRedis) which is the default
for oslo-incubator. Fixed unit test to pass the check.

The patch does not belong to master where old RPC layer was removed
since Kilo. Neither it belongs to oslo.messaging since the test was not
copied there.

Closes-Bug: #1259532
Change-Id: Id54e78ca56bb5a5bf1cdad31bc5965ff02c0d9b4

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-07 17:51:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

The Apache cookbook has been updated to 2.0.0 to support ubuntu > 13.10.

Change-Id: I61a37fdb39b552c29623d2e12063c595c79f9715

commit_message:
Updated version number inclusion of Apache2 cookbook.

The Apache cookbook has been updated to 2.0.0 to support ubuntu > 13.10.
This cookbook was blocking the update via Berks due to the dependency being set to less than 2.0.0.
In order to get this cookbook to function on Ubuntu 14.04 the dependency must be updated to include the 2.0 release.

Change-Id: I61a37fdb39b552c29623d2e12063c595c79f9715

commit_message:
Swift content enhancements and fixes

I updated the swift content in the installation guide with a
few enhancements and fixes as follows:

1) Improved wording/phrasing (thanks Joe Robinson).
2) Improved consistency of duplicate content.
3) Added example output from ring builder commands.
4) Addressed other minor issues.

Change-Id: I14b6f07877677b3c1b38271150e7c39d19c2c96f
Partial-Bug: #1389382
backport: juno

[{'created': '2014-10-20 14:12:28.000000000', 'message': 'Changed order of calls to register new nodes

Modified agent to checking if node was before registered, based on existence
of nailgun_uid file. If file exist, only put is call, in other case when we
try made post (if call was succes-201 or node exist 409, we call put method)

Change-Id: Id1ef1650cf47c8e5fd7e844362b3fb41afad8fdd
Closes-Bug: #1305017
(cherry picked from commit 779afd8882b119f7fc4eb69b3edd3e9efd63b42d)
'}]
commit_message:
Changed order of calls to register new nodes

Modified agent to checking if node was before registered, based on existence
of nailgun_uid file. If file exist, only put is call, in other case when we
try made post (if call was succes-201 or node exist 409, we call put method)

Change-Id: Id1ef1650cf47c8e5fd7e844362b3fb41afad8fdd
Closes-Bug: #1305017
(cherry picked from commit 779afd8882b119f7fc4eb69b3edd3e9efd63b42d)

Report licenses on all packages

for all included packages.

commit_message:
Add cli commands to work with release networks

Added two commands to read/modify release networks

fuel rel --rel 1 --networks --download
Read networks from api and saves them in yaml format
on file system, you should be able to modify them and
send back with

fuel rel --rel 1 --networks --upload

DocImpact
Change-Id: I774ab8341b45a86bbf77d266aa788424936776cc

[{'created': '2014-11-05 11:59:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for release network_metadata serialziation

Patch adds support for release network metadata serialization,
by adding additional handler on release/<release_id>/networks for PUT/GET
requestss
Proper validation for release networking data

Why not to add another field in release handler:
1. networks_metadata it is ours internal naming
2. url release/<release_id>/networks makes more sense for client
  applications

commit_message:
Add support for release network_metadata serialziation

Patch adds support for release network metadata serialization,
by adding additional handler on release/<release_id>/networks for PUT/GET
requestss
Proper validation for release networking data

Why not to add another field in release handler:
1. networks_metadata it is ours internal naming
2. url release/<release_id>/networks makes more sense for client
  applications

Change-Id: I205ec786f1a9d772905ff22e426c1ce8a6d4d6e7
Closes-Bug: 1381557

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 7585, 'date': '2014-06-09 16:37:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

(8 comments)

Thank you for the spec, I have several comments to that.

I don't like to see this prepared for only one option. And by default, Ceilometer is already there and will provide all those simple stats for TripleO-UI. It's a strong combination to have Management and Monitoring in one place. And for the simple monitoring like you describe, TripleO-UI is just enough. 

I am not saying people will not use Nagios(or similar) with TripleO CLI or Nagios with TripleO UI. Cause we won't be definitely re-implementing Nagios advanced features. 

So what I would like to see, how it will look like if we deploy just chek_mk agent, can we use it in Ceilometer, what stats exactly does it bring? Or we will deploy Icinga, can we use the API to show the data in TripleO UI? What advance monitoring features will it bring? Do you want to handle also logs with this? ... It should be described layer by layer, not as a one big solution."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-09 17:00:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGit#Test_Failures

- gate-tripleo-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/50/91750/2/check/gate-tripleo-specs-python27/3561421 : FAILURE in 36s
- gate-tripleo-specs-docs http://logs.openstack.org/50/91750/2/check/gate-tripleo-specs-docs/ad03482 : FAILURE in 38s'}, {'account_id': 7537, 'date': '2014-06-10 11:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(9 comments)

Comments inline to answer most points raised.

Check_MK gives us a very easy way to create and distribute new checks to all nodes from individual elements.

The entire premise of this is that sometimes there are things we want to check that are outside the OpenStack ecosystem and therefore not recorded in Ceilometer (iLO firmware versions for example).

This solution is also firmly aimed at systems-level alerting, not billing metrics or stack-trace reporting, hence the suggestion of utilising an industry-standard existing solution to provide functionality currently lacking.'}, {'account_id': 7537, 'date': '2014-06-10 13:36:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

OK, one more thing to add.

This does not do any log shipping, analysis or other related things.  Check_MK will alert on basic regexs it finds in /var/log/syslog and /var/log/messages, however it is *not* a log monitoring solution.

This is one layer of what could become a comprehensive monitoring system.  It solely deals with alerting when infrastructure issues are encountered. It is not designed or intended to deal with system or application metrics, logging, metering and billing or any other style of monitoring.

I will update the blueprint to reflect this once I have had further feedback.'}, {'account_id': 7537, 'date': '2014-06-10 14:05:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-10 14:05:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:
