'}, {'created': '2014-08-22 03:47:25.000000000', 'message': 'Reorganize DbTestCase to use provisioning completely

This change is the first part in a series of changes
that will allow for full flexibility in database usage
during tests.   The first step is to add more facility
to the oslo.db.sqlalchemy.provision system, implementing
a dispatch system that allows flexibility in creation
and dropping of databases, as well as moving the awareness
of the "openstack_citest" convention into provisioning.
The OpportunisticFixture and OpportunisticTestCase now
fold into DbFixture and DbTestCase, which defers in a simple
way to provision.ProvisionedDatabase for all connectivity.
ProvisionedDatabase in turn decides based on the given
environment as to how an engine should be provisioned
for a given test.

Control of database connectivity remains via the
OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION environment variable.  When not
set, connectivity defaults to sqlite://, plus those backends
found to be available using "opportunistic" naming conventions.
When the variable is present, it provides a semicolon-delimited
list of URLs, and only those URLs will be used for initial
connectivity.

Future changes will allow provisioning to hold onto a single
database engine per test run, as well as allow a single
test class to run in multiple backend scenarios (e.g. one test
against many different backends).

Change-Id: Ifc02505c4c8ebd4a1ca56e14f76c0989576875c3
Partial-Bug: #1339206

'}, {'created': '2014-09-12 15:51:54.000000000', 'message': 'Reorganize DbTestCase to use provisioning completely

This change is the first part in a series of changes
that will allow for full flexibility in database usage
during tests.   The first step is to add more facility
to the oslo.db.sqlalchemy.provision system, implementing
a dispatch system that allows flexibility in creation
and dropping of databases, as well as moving the awareness
of the "openstack_citest" convention into provisioning.
The OpportunisticFixture and OpportunisticTestCase now
fold into DbFixture and DbTestCase, which defers in a simple
way to provision.ProvisionedDatabase for all connectivity.
ProvisionedDatabase in turn decides based on the given
environment as to how an engine should be provisioned
for a given test.

Control of database connectivity remains via the
OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION environment variable.  When not
set, connectivity defaults to sqlite://, plus those backends
found to be available using "opportunistic" naming conventions.
When the variable is present, it provides a semicolon-delimited
list of URLs, and only those URLs will be used for initial
connectivity.

Future changes will allow provisioning to hold onto a single
database engine per test run, as well as allow a single
test class to run in multiple backend scenarios (e.g. one test
against many different backends).

Change-Id: Ifc02505c4c8ebd4a1ca56e14f76c0989576875c3
Partial-Bug: #1339206

commit_message:
Reorganize DbTestCase to use provisioning completely

This change is the first part in a series of changes
that will allow for full flexibility in database usage
during tests.  The first step is to add more facility
to the oslo.db.sqlalchemy.provision system, implementing
a dispatch system that allows flexibility in creation
and dropping of databases, as well as moving the awareness
of the "openstack_citest" convention into provisioning.
The OpportunisticFixture and OpportunisticTestCase now
fold into DbFixture and DbTestCase, which defers in a simple
way to provision.ProvisionedDatabase for all connectivity.
ProvisionedDatabase in turn decides based on the given
environment as to how an engine should be provisioned
for a given test.

Control of database connectivity remains via the
OS_TEST_DBAPI_ADMIN_CONNECTION environment variable.  When not
set, connectivity defaults to sqlite://, plus those backends
found to be available using "opportunistic" naming conventions.
When the variable is present, it provides a semicolon-delimited
list of URLs, and only those URLs will be used for initial
connectivity.

Future changes will allow provisioning to hold onto a single
database engine per test run, as well as allow a single
test class to run in multiple backend scenarios (e.g. one test
against many different backends).

Change-Id: Ifc02505c4c8ebd4a1ca56e14f76c0989576875c3
Partial-Bug: #1339206

The .pylintrc used for neutron refers to checks added in pylint 1.3.0,

commit_message:
Allow newer versions of pylint

The .pylintrc used for neutron refers to checks added in pylint 1.3.0,
and aborts on earlier versions (from a quick experiment).

This change moves from a strict pylint==0.25.2 pin to allow newer
versions, as a first step to moving to pylint>=1.3.0.

Change-Id: Ia293eb1329f2c1c2894ab7d8d2142951e670fbaf

[{'created': '2014-10-31 20:43:38.000000000', 'message': 'Activate pep8 check that _ is imported

Remove the specification in tox.ini that _ is a builtin so that
it will no longer assume that _ does not need to be imported.

commit_message:
Activate pep8 check that _ is imported

Remove the specification in tox.ini that _ is a builtin so that
it will no longer assume that _ does not need to be imported.

This helps ensure that the _ from i18n is used.

Activating this check did not flag any violations.

Change-Id: Idc4d6259d4eb2db66e7122535bc42f8647049a06

[{'created': '2014-09-26 21:28:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add _wrap_db_error() support to SessionTransaction.commit()

This patch adds _wrap_db_error() to the commit()
and rollback() methods of sqlalchemy.orm.session.SessionTransaction,
which is the object that is dealt with when one invokes
code of the form "with session.begin():".  The context manager
form does not invoke the commit() method on the
SQLAlchemy Session directly, and instead calls the one
local to the SessionTransaction.

In order to intercept this, we must build a subclass
of SessionTransaction with the appropriate wrapping, and
then patch it into the object that is returned by
Session.begin(), ensuring that it is compatible with
_wrap_db_error().

This whole approach is legacy; newer oslo.db versions
intercept errors at the point at which they occur
via engine events.

Tests are omitted here as we are relying upon the tests
that were added to the corresponding oslo-incubator code.

Closes-bug: #1370191

Change-Id: Ie0456e6daa86c99cf6fbe56ca5dfd8a618f14232
'}]
commit_message:
Add _wrap_db_error() support to SessionTransaction.commit()

This patch adds _wrap_db_error() to the commit()
and rollback() methods of sqlalchemy.orm.session.SessionTransaction,
which is the object that is dealt with when one invokes
code of the form "with session.begin():".  The context manager
form does not invoke the commit() method on the
SQLAlchemy Session directly, and instead calls the one
local to the SessionTransaction.

In order to intercept this, we must build a subclass
of SessionTransaction with the appropriate wrapping, and
then patch it into the object that is returned by
Session.begin(), ensuring that it is compatible with
_wrap_db_error().

This whole approach is legacy; newer oslo.db versions
intercept errors at the point at which they occur
via engine events.

Tests are omitted here as we are relying upon the tests
that were added to the corresponding oslo-incubator code.

Closes-bug: #1370191

Change-Id: Ie0456e6daa86c99cf6fbe56ca5dfd8a618f14232

commit_message:
Correct "To create a server" SDK example

"To create a server" SDK example incorrectly used net_id instead of
net.id when assigning the network identifier to a NIC.

Change-Id: Ica993938c57e048f56c03c777ccdebae7ffdedfa
Closes-Bug: #1390347
backport: juno
(cherry picked from commit 404206136c3f155ef90a360338ccbcbe197e7d4a)

commit_message:
Add 'my_ip' option to cinder storage node

I added the 'my_ip' option to cinder.conf for cinder storage
nodes.

Change-Id: Ifd79b8299c8e7ea04f0ac7e1a75dd8ed57546383
Closes-Bug: #1381976

commit_message:
Replace trivial instances of tenant for project

This patch replaces the trivial instances were the word tenant is used.
No model is touched yet.

Partially implements: blueprint replace-concept-of-tenants-for-projects

Change-Id: Id21a34d2c414e0497a943ace970584369bd1d83f

commit_message:
neutron-db-manage finds automatically config file

This patch lets oslo.config find config file containing connection
string to database by itself. Config file can be overriden by
--config-file cli parameter as it was before, so it is backward
compatible.

Change-Id: Iacbcd65edfe9ef268a0caf80641e0937a99b06a7
Closes-Bug: 1381100

commit_message:
Fix uninstalled packages for ubuntu

1) bdsmainutils
Fixes heat deployment issues since puppet recipes improperly handle
`hexdump` presence.

Closes-Bug: #1389279

2) bridge-utils
Fixes the absence of `brctl` utility

Change-Id: Idbc1ec089723dfa01d0b91bfc0e2c9771d7805e7

commit_message:
Parametrize headless option for VirtualBox

If you need to start VirtualBox VMs without a GUI, for example, on a
remote computer, you can now set the 'headless' parameter in config.sh
to '1'.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1304345

Change-Id: I868fa67335506a5e048d37411f5d5795b560a338

Closes-Bug: Calling update in aggregator.py does not return any value. Updated to the correct way of calling it.

Change-Id: Iaa2706dc8df53d32b5bbf9f1dc136b2be459a5d0

commit_message:
Add cliff-tablib to requirements

cliff-tablib gives cliff the ability to format list and show output in
html, json, or yaml (http://cliff-tablib.readthedocs.org/). This patch
adds cliff-tablib to requirements.txt so that it can be installed along
with cliff.

Change-Id: I4daab97642482e6f40cd8209ff5edd9c680092c0

The functional tests devstack gate job currently skips tests
that require keystone v3 API. In conjunction with changes to
devstack [0] this patch will cause the gate job to use keystone
v3 API and stop skipping those tests.

Devstack sets auth version in its /etc/swift/test.conf by

commit_message:
Change default keystone auth version to 3 in test/sample.conf

The functional tests devstack gate job currently skips tests
that require keystone v3 API. In conjunction with changes to
devstack [0] this patch will cause the gate job to use keystone
v3 API and stop skipping those tests.

Devstack sets auth version in its /etc/swift/test.conf by
uncommenting the value found in test/sample.conf, so the change
in this patch is sufficient to cause the v3 API to be used.

The devstack patch [0] sets the correct auth url for the v3 API
and creates a fourth test account that is required for the
currently skipped tests to run.

[0] change id I557de01bf196075f2f3adcdf4dd1b43756d8a0ae

Change-Id: I44e159b939f5e3fc3780612823d12262013ea793

commit_message:
Pylint Fixes (bad-builtin, bad-indentation, duplicate-key)

Removes the following pylint exceptions and fixes the violations:
 * bad-builtin
 * bad-indentation
 * duplicate-key

This change prefers using all() and any() over allowing indentation
of complex multi-line if statements to match up against the block
that the if statement creates. This was previously solved by
double-indenting in several places.

Change-Id: Ic8705228515d6c07744004d6cf32764cda2611d3

commit_message:
Fix xen plugin to retry on upload failure

The xen plugin does not catch all cases where upload can throw
an exception due to connection failures and timeouts.  This
change extends the try/execpt window to catch these cases.

Also added original connect which in part keeps us from lazy-loading
the connection and logging of exception information so we can
figure out later what happened.

Change-Id: If643a7da9f602ab7bb5d255031a841c674fa6c6f
Fixes-bug: 1378903

commit_message:
Pool Manager - Central/Storage Changes

domains table changes:
- Added 'ERROR' to status column
- Set status column default to 'PENDING'
- Added action column ('CREATE', 'DELETE', 'UPDATE', 'NONE')
  with a default of 'CREATE'

records table changes:
- Added 'ERROR' to status column
- Set status column default to 'PENDING'
- Added serial column with a default of 1
- Added action column ('CREATE', 'DELETE', 'UPDATE', 'NONE')
  with a default of 'CREATE'

Other modifications:
- Modified domain object to reflect new attribute (action)
- Modified record object to reflect new attributes (serial, action)
- Ensured central service continues to work by setting status of
  domain and record to 'ACTIVE'
- Added update_status method to central service

Change-Id: I893f8e7834de4c6ccf3ad587af65a7eee24415b3
Partially-implements: blueprint server-pools-service

commit_message:
Proposal for moving Glance tests to tempest

This proposal intends to discuss the best possible approach
for transitioning some of the Glance functional tests to Tempest.
This also helps continue our efforts for reducing Glance Gap
Coverage in Tempest.

Change-Id: I7c05b3ff43168b3b04f79bcf5b4ad9f37047610f

commit_message:
Update some options in nova.conf.erb

Update option compute_scheduler_driver to scheduler_driver.
Remove option max_cores since it is not appeared in latest release.

Reference below patch for details
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26625/
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/15068/

Closes-Bug: #1389624

commit_message:
Increase the 'all' timeout because slow tests are included

The default for tempest in .testr.conf is 500s. This was too short for
the heat slow tests so the time for that was increased to 1200. This
change is to a periodic job so if we need to it can be increased more
in the future.

Change-Id: If27ddef9865c54b997130c707382d2014d82e0a6

commit_message:
Pin nova

Nova a removed a load of deprecated options from nova.conf, we're not
currently using the new options so a temporary pin will allow our CI to
continue which we sort the problem.

Related-Bug: #1390427

Change-Id: I1719e11981a4d2e56385a76a47b9aa1e16062e9a

[{'created': '2014-11-07 15:44:42.000000000', 'message': "Restore python3 tests to safe_encode

The safe_encode function in oslo-incubator contained logic to decode
on python3, which hasn't made it into encodeutils.

Without this logic, things using safe_encode, like cliutils.print_list
in oslo-incubator, mangle output on python3.

Change-Id: If21f1de0e1c0a5fc000328ae403b458b551c02a4
Closes-Bug: #1390505
"}]
commit_message:
Restore python3 tests to safe_encode

The safe_encode function in oslo-incubator contained logic to decode
on python3, which hasn't made it into encodeutils.

Without this logic, things using safe_encode, like cliutils.print_list
in oslo-incubator, mangle output on python3.

Change-Id: If21f1de0e1c0a5fc000328ae403b458b551c02a4
Closes-Bug: #1390505

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-07 15:49:29.000000000', 'message': "Update swift content

I updated the swift content in the installation guide as
follows:

1) Consolidated Identity service configuration into proxy
   service configuration section.
2) Changed initial example architecture to install the proxy
   service on the controller node instead of a separate node.
   However, I used wording that supports separate and/or
   multiple proxy services.
3) The steps to configure memcached break installations with
   horizon because the latter references 127.0.0.1 instead
   of the management network interface IP address. After
   consolidating the proxy service to a single instance on
   the controller node, it now references 127.0.0.1.
4) Changed initial example architecture to install two
   storage nodes rather than five storage nodes to reduce
   the barrier to entry for users that want to try swift.
   However, I used wording that supports additional storage
   nodes and also references the swift documentation for
   larger deployments.
5) Changed the initial example architecture to use only the
   management network instead of a separate storage/replication
   network because the original instructions didn't actually use
   the latter. Fully implementing a separate storage/replication
   network requires a considerably more complex configuration
   and eliminating it reduces the barrier to entry for users
   that want to try swift. However, I used wording that
   mentions a separate storage/replication network and also
   references the swift documentation for larger deployments.
6) The Ubuntu and RHEL/CentOS/Fedora packages include ancient
   upstream/example configuration files that contain
   deprecated/defunct options and lack options that enable
   useful features. Packages take a while to fix, so the
   instructions now pull the upstream configuration files.
7) Removed the steps to create disk labels and partitions on
   the storage nodes because a variety of methods exist and
   users should choose their own method.
8) Changed rsync to run as a standard service rather than use
   the xinetd wrapper on RHEL/CentOS/Fedora.
9) Separated account, container, and object ring creation steps
   into separate sections to improve clarity and reduce typos.
10) Reduced partition power from 18 to 10 during ring creation
    because the example architecture shouldn't scale to the higher
    value using the example architecture.
11) Changed storage node service management steps on Ubuntu to
    use 'swift-init' rather than manually starting a large
    number of services.
12) Modified file names and IDs to increase consistency with
    other content in the guide.

I recommend backporting to Juno as this chapter wasn't
functional in time for release. Also, I'm planning to
improve the diagrams in a future patch.

Change-Id: I26710efe16e8cb6ed1a20ebc70b3f6d5962536d1
Partial-Bug: #1389382
Implements: blueprint installation-guide-improvements
backport: juno
(cherry picked from commit ff5ef1b66a039549671ad99efa1de79fd52fc14e)
"}]
commit_message:
Update swift content

I updated the swift content in the installation guide as
follows:

1) Consolidated Identity service configuration into proxy
   service configuration section.
2) Changed initial example architecture to install the proxy
   service on the controller node instead of a separate node.
   However, I used wording that supports separate and/or
   multiple proxy services.
3) The steps to configure memcached break installations with
   horizon because the latter references 127.0.0.1 instead
   of the management network interface IP address. After
   consolidating the proxy service to a single instance on
   the controller node, it now references 127.0.0.1.
4) Changed initial example architecture to install two
   storage nodes rather than five storage nodes to reduce
   the barrier to entry for users that want to try swift.
   However, I used wording that supports additional storage
   nodes and also references the swift documentation for
   larger deployments.
5) Changed the initial example architecture to use only the
   management network instead of a separate storage/replication
   network because the original instructions didn't actually use
   the latter. Fully implementing a separate storage/replication
   network requires a considerably more complex configuration
   and eliminating it reduces the barrier to entry for users
   that want to try swift. However, I used wording that
   mentions a separate storage/replication network and also
   references the swift documentation for larger deployments.
6) The Ubuntu and RHEL/CentOS/Fedora packages include ancient
   upstream/example configuration files that contain
   deprecated/defunct options and lack options that enable
   useful features. Packages take a while to fix, so the
   instructions now pull the upstream configuration files.
7) Removed the steps to create disk labels and partitions on
   the storage nodes because a variety of methods exist and
   users should choose their own method.
8) Changed rsync to run as a standard service rather than use
   the xinetd wrapper on RHEL/CentOS/Fedora.
9) Separated account, container, and object ring creation steps
   into separate sections to improve clarity and reduce typos.
10) Reduced partition power from 18 to 10 during ring creation
    because the example architecture shouldn't scale to the higher
    value using the example architecture.
11) Changed storage node service management steps on Ubuntu to
    use 'swift-init' rather than manually starting a large
    number of services.
12) Modified file names and IDs to increase consistency with
    other content in the guide.

I recommend backporting to Juno as this chapter wasn't
functional in time for release. Also, I'm planning to
improve the diagrams in a future patch.

Change-Id: I26710efe16e8cb6ed1a20ebc70b3f6d5962536d1
Partial-Bug: #1389382
Implements: blueprint installation-guide-improvements
backport: juno
(cherry picked from commit ff5ef1b66a039549671ad99efa1de79fd52fc14e)

commit_message:
Mount /etc/yum.repos.d from host to storage-repo

We have to mount /etc/yum.repos.d into fuel-storage-repo container if we
want to get latest repos inside containers. Otherwise we will have
latest repos, but they won't be used.

Change-Id: Idf4058a95420ee57183c3c55ac988bdff861c933
Closes-Bug: #1390375

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-07 14:46:15.000000000', 'message': "Handle NetworkNotFound on addFixedIp API

If passing non-existent network to addFixedIp API, an exception
NetworkNotFoundForUUID happens. However, current API doesn't handle
this case.

This patch makes v2.0/v2.1 API handle this case.
This patch adds NetworkNotFound handling instead of the one of
NetworkNotFoundForUUID for readable code and covering additional
exceptions in the future.

Change-Id: I3851689e326182c0af2dca11a6b3b3c67d6c9e5b
"}]
commit_message:
Handle NetworkNotFound on addFixedIp API

If passing non-existent network to addFixedIp API, an exception
NetworkNotFoundForUUID happens. However, current API doesn't handle
this case.

This patch makes v2.0/v2.1 API handle this case.
This patch adds NetworkNotFound handling instead of the one of
NetworkNotFoundForUUID for readable code and covering additional
exceptions in the future.

Change-Id: I3851689e326182c0af2dca11a6b3b3c67d6c9e5b

commit_message:
Allow jenkins to log into the host as root

The architecture under which beaker is used is that
the jenkins user will run a program that ssh's back
into the host itself. It needs root privs to do this.

If jenkins can already do that, or a different builder
is more appropriate, please let me know.

Change-Id: I5d05edb9d0f3e7a8b32981d7943019bfb5fea04c

commit_message:
multinode_setup allow private ip

Allow all nodes to connect to each other on the fixed/private ips.

This change realated to:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/114840/

Change-Id: I4b70f9184591d4563ce7b0a1b163b4055604f334

commit_message:
Generate a drop down field for custom heat parameters

If the heat template parameter has a custom constraint of
'nova.flavor', the form will generate a drop down field with a
list of all possible flavors the current user has access to.

Change-Id: Ic4f4baeebc5e8a5fdbf3c3c0f073fed68dd1b114
blueprint: heat-template-choices
Co-Authored-By: Cédric Soulas <cedric.soulas@cloudwatt.com>

subject: Generate image choices for custom heat constraints

commit_message:
Generate image choices for custom heat constraints

If the heat template parameter has a custom constraint of
'glance.image', the form will generate a drop down field with a
list of all possible images the current user has access to.

Change-Id: I7abc4448c9492056437f7b70a93510882880bee0
blueprint: heat-template-choices

subject: Generate keypair choices for custom heat constraints

commit_message:
Generate keypair choices for custom heat constraints

If the heat template parameter has a custom constraint of
'nova.keypair', the form will generate a drop down field with a
list of all possible keypairs.

Change-Id: I855ee01a54e52572ab14646804de9b7d821acb17
blueprint: heat-template-choices
Co-Authored-By: Cédric Soulas <cedric.soulas@cloudwatt.com>

subject: Generate network choices for custom heat constraints

commit_message:
Generate network choices for custom heat constraints

If the heat parameter has a custom contraint of 'neutron.network'.
The form will generate choice field with a list of possible networks
to select from.

Change-Id: Ifd9932465e0c62e0ea2dd3b22531474f8b48c01c
blueprint: heat-template-choices

subject: add the major version: bp/thunderboost
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-05-18 02:29:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 11158, 'date': '2014-05-18 02:29:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2014-05-18 02:29:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-05-18 02:29:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

- gate-nova-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/60/94060/1/check/gate-nova-specs-python27/9138ac5 : SUCCESS in 39s
- gate-nova-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/60/94060/1/check/gate-nova-specs-docs/3b01d4d/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 37s'}, {'account_id': 7677, 'date': '2014-05-19 17:22:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

There are a couple of issues with this: first, it seems that VMThunder does several things at once, at least one of which we already do: image caching.  According to the website, it also does: On-demand data transfer, P2P image transfer, and some form of prefetching.  For the former two, I'd really like to see those as optional plugins of some sort.  It seems to me that any attempt to integrate these technologies should a) be done in a generic way not specific to VMThunder, and b) not be done in a way that requires them to all be used at once.

There was some discussion at summit of a magical glanceclient that supported ideas like these as plugins and hid them from Nova, which would be a nice way to use these technologies without Nova having to know about them (which, IMHO, it shouldn't have to)."}, {'account_id': 11565, 'date': '2014-05-20 15:55:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Ross
Image caching in VMThunder is different from what we already have in nova. Nova has a image cache in file-level, whereas VMThunder needs a cache in block-level.

VMThunder is an integration of 4 things: on-demand transferring (with iSCSI), block-level caching (with flashcache), P2P transferring and prefetching, whereas only on-demand transferring exists in openstack today, so VMThunder has to build them on it's own. The truth is, these 4 things are relatively independent, and can be made as options to turned on/off, as long as it is desired. 

The only constraint is functional dependences: on-demand transferring is required by caching and prefetching; caching is required by P2P. For example, on-demand transferring and caching can be turned on, while P2P and prefetching are turned off, but caching can not be turn-on alone.

>a magical glanceclient that supported ideas 
>like these as plugins and hid them from Nova
This is the right way. 
Is this a common view at the summit?"}, {'account_id': 11565, 'date': '2014-05-20 15:57:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Ross

Image caching in VMThunder is different from what we already have in nova. Nova has a image cache in file-level, whereas VMThunder needs a cache in block-level.

VMThunder is an integration of 4 things: on-demand transferring (with iSCSI), block-level caching (with flashcache), P2P transferring and prefetching, whereas only on-demand transferring exists in openstack today, so VMThunder has to build them on it's own. The truth is, these 4 things are relatively independent, and can be made as options to turned on/off, as long as it is desired. 

The only constraint is functional dependences: on-demand transferring is required by caching and prefetching; caching is required by P2P. For example, on-demand transferring and caching can be turned on, while P2P and prefetching are turned off, but caching can not be turn-on alone.

>a magical glanceclient that supported ideas 

>like these as plugins and hid them from Nova

This is the right way. 

Is this a common view at the summit?"}, {'account_id': 7677, 'date': '2014-05-20 16:07:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

people seemed to like the idea of having glanceclient be in charge of anything related to speeding up the transfer of images being in glanceclient, at least in one of the Nova sessions about this and related subjects.  I would talk to the glance people and see what they think.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-05-21 16:24:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Verified

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2014-05-21 16:24:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Just some style/house keeping points inline - don't have an opinion on the feature itself yet."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-05-21 16:35:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

- gate-nova-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/60/94060/1/check/gate-nova-specs-python27/7fd69a6 : SUCCESS in 49s
- gate-nova-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/60/94060/1/check/gate-nova-specs-docs/43f2dc5/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 04s'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2014-05-23 13:13:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm with Solly here that this feels like a very specific interation with an external product.  I like the idea of being able to use boottime accelerators, but I'd like it to be a more general plugin of some kind (of which vmthunder could then be a driver).

Its not really clear to me if this fits into Glance or Cinder - Nova can boot from either, or a combination in the case where it dynamically creates a boot volume from an image in Glance.  This feels like it complicates that set of options further to the user, and I'd rather see it as something that Deployer choose to configure that something the user has to select."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2014-06-25 11:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This spec looks to be abandoned, so I am marking this as abandoned. Sorry if this was not the case, feel free to restore the change.

[{'created': '2014-11-06 22:04:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add ODL_NAME variable for OpenDaylight configuration

This makes the name of the unzipped package configurable so you can run
with releases other than the default specified in lib/opendaylight.

Change-Id: Iad879c558d742da03375cb61b0c2ef141573ffec
'}]
commit_message:
Add ODL_NAME variable for OpenDaylight configuration

This makes the name of the unzipped package configurable so you can run
with releases other than the default specified in lib/opendaylight.

Change-Id: Iad879c558d742da03375cb61b0c2ef141573ffec

commit_message:
Use 'pg_ctl' utility to start and stop database

Greping output for  starting message don't work all the time
because 'postgres' utility translate messages in other language
depending on computer settings

Change-Id: I6f48db92ccc16e8c75d76dd3fadbbeb9930f9cac

[{'account_id': 13035, 'date': '2014-08-23 16:18:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2014-08-23 16:18:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-08-23 16:18:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13035, 'date': '2014-08-25 18:20:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13035, 'date': '2014-08-25 18:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2014-08-25 20:12:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi ! Thanks for contributing.

I'd like to better understand the use case where we would not like to manage the repository. I'm not fundamentally opposed to this but can you tell me why you would prefer to manage the repository yourself ? If there are specific parameters for your repository, can we make ceph::repo support them instead ?

What I can think of right now is that the location is hardcoded to ceph.com while there are other mirrors available (such as eu.ceph.com, ceph.mirror.iweb.ca).

I'll actually submit a commit for the above.

Thanks."}, {'account_id': 10540, 'date': '2014-08-25 20:23:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

One use-case is that we have internal mirrors that don't match the structure or paths of the upstream mirrors.  We mirror all of our external mirrors internally so they all are handled the same way."}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2014-08-25 20:25:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

If the location of the repository can be specified in ceph::repo, does that solve the problem ?'}, {'account_id': 10540, 'date': '2014-08-25 20:29:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

It would be something we could work around, but generally we prefer to use our own classes for repo management, since we have a lot of conditional behavior that is generalized in those classes.   If we *must* configure the ceph repos using the ceph module, then that's extra work."}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2014-08-25 20:52:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Ok. I understand, thanks.

I've submitted https://review.openstack.org/#/c/116724/ anyway because it's an easy improvement. I'll submit my reviews in another comment."}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2014-08-25 21:05:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2014-08-25 21:09:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Added hook 'ceph::profile::params::manage_repo'.

Whether we should manage the local repository (true) or depend on what is available (false). Set this to false when you want to manage the the repo by yourself.

Change-Id: I45000830eeb8ea3ffd69c2e4fe4d538360528186

commit_message:
Prevent from error "Models aren't loaded yet."

Change the version of the devops package which
requires Django<1.7

Change-Id: I0ac4996779e6e158c1faac2311ad1011d5ff5130
Closes-Bug: 1376275

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-01 06:54:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix storage.hbase.util.prepare_key() for 32-bits system

storage.hbase.utils.timestamp() will return long type object on 32-bits
system, which will cause exception in ceilometer/alarm/storage/impl_hbase.py:
'long' object has no attribute 'encode'.
Then developers on 32-bits system will never get local test passed.

This patch changes type check in prepare_keys() from int to six.integer_types,
which will work for both 32-bits and 64-bits system, python2 and python3
environment.

Note: no test code is added, because jenkins runs on 64-bits system. Reviewers
can download code and verify it on 32-bits system.

Change-Id: I57729ff67efe6d6036fe698e3d86491f9ed4600c
Closes-Bug: #1388181
"}]
commit_message:
Fix storage.hbase.util.prepare_key() for 32-bits system

storage.hbase.utils.timestamp() will return long type object on 32-bits
system, which will cause exception in ceilometer/alarm/storage/impl_hbase.py:
'long' object has no attribute 'encode'.
Then developers on 32-bits system will never get local test passed.

This patch changes type check in prepare_keys() from int to six.integer_types,
which will work for both 32-bits and 64-bits system, python2 and python3
environment.

Note: no test code is added, because jenkins runs on 64-bits system. Reviewers
can download code and verify it on 32-bits system.

Change-Id: I57729ff67efe6d6036fe698e3d86491f9ed4600c
Closes-Bug: #1388181

[{'created': '2014-11-07 12:22:28.000000000', 'message': "Use LC_ALL=C in openrc

export LC_ALL=C is required to avoid
'unsupported locale setting' errors then
invoking CLI commands in Ubuntu.

Closes-bug: #1390431

Change-Id: Ie980563025e9938f769ee0e16b629b8cf673d8c7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Use LC_ALL=C in openrc

export LC_ALL=C is required to avoid
'unsupported locale setting' errors then
invoking CLI commands in Ubuntu.

Closes-bug: #1390431

Change-Id: Ie980563025e9938f769ee0e16b629b8cf673d8c7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Excluding alembic migrations from coverage

Currently we cannot tests the migrations within our unit test setup. We
should look into alternative ways of testing migrations and their
coverage.

Change-Id: I5fbc4957a7ed1e0924bce562530adbe5fd2d966b

[{'created': '2014-11-07 08:30:59.000000000', 'message': 'Correct "To create a server" SDK example

"To create a server" SDK example incorrectly used net_id instead of
net.id when assigning the network identifier to a NIC.

Change-Id: Ica993938c57e048f56c03c777ccdebae7ffdedfa
Closes-Bug: #1390347
backport: juno
'}]
commit_message:
Correct "To create a server" SDK example

"To create a server" SDK example incorrectly used net_id instead of
net.id when assigning the network identifier to a NIC.

Change-Id: Ica993938c57e048f56c03c777ccdebae7ffdedfa
Closes-Bug: #1390347
backport: juno

commit_message:
Update V3 client for server create list response

This patch updates the client which consumes server create responses
as the server POST response changes from the first server to a list of
all created servers in V3.

The Nova side change is here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/54214/

DocImpact

Part of blueprint return-all-servers-during-multiple-create

Change-Id: I996dd1a46fd7048fe70e8f460176d0847d78d30a

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2014-08-05 20:52:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

(2 comments)

Thanks for working on this.

The reason for my -2 here is that the v3 are not executed anymore, and we have a policy against accepting code which is not tested in the gate.

I'm surprised that nova is doing changes to the V3 api with the v2.1 discussion going on, and with no v3 tests executed in the gate. 

Is there a periodic or experimental job still running the nova v3 tests?

The rest of my inline comments are mostly stylistics, not so important."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-08-05 20:52:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Abandoning for now as v2.1 and microversions are going on.'}]

commit_message:
Update v3 API tests for server create list response

This patch updates tests which consume server create responses as the
server POST response changes from the first server to a list of all
created servers in V3.

The Nova side change is here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/54214/

Part of blueprint return-all-servers-during-multiple-create

Change-Id: Idad9f56e50928ecb3cfc241d3895c5d413521f86

subject: handle hypervisor_hostname target for live migrate

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-19 05:33:12.000000000', 'message': 'handle hypervisor_hostname target for live migrate

This change handles the scenario where a user might specify the
hypervisor hostname (long name) as the target host in the live
migrate api call. Currently, the user receives a 400 error
response ComputeServiceUnavailable when specifying "hostname.local"
instead of the expected e.g. "hostname" of the associated service.
The hypervisor hostname seems a reasonable way to specify the
target host of a live migration and users can be confused when
service has short name "hostname" and hypervisor has long name
"hostname.local" having success in one case and an error in other.

In this patch, we catch ComputeServiceUnavailable and check if a
compute node exists with that name. If one exists, we retry the live
migrate api call using the service host associated with the compute
node, else we re-raise.

Change-Id: I8a952f0203617eb5d4314317fb00da67936a524f
Closes-Bug: #1310340
'}, {'created': '2014-06-19 07:16:35.000000000', 'message': 'handle hypervisor_hostname target for live migrate

commit_message:
handle hypervisor_hostname target for live migrate

This change handles the scenario where a user might specify the
hypervisor hostname (long name) as the target host in the live
migrate api call. Currently, the user receives a 400 error
response ComputeServiceUnavailable when specifying "hostname.local"
instead of the expected e.g. "hostname" of the associated service.
The hypervisor hostname seems a reasonable way to specify the
target host of a live migration and users can be confused when
service has short name "hostname" and hypervisor has long name
"hostname.local" having success in one case and an error in other.

In this patch, we catch ComputeServiceUnavailable and check if a
compute node exists with that name. If one exists, we retry the live
migrate api call using the service host associated with the compute
node. If no hosts are found, we re-raise. If more than one host is
found, we raise HTTPConflict.

Change-Id: I8a952f0203617eb5d4314317fb00da67936a524f
Closes-Bug: #1310340

@alaski I agree it interacts.

A failed build in Nova leaves you with an instance in an ERROR state, which implies the instance is created regardless of if the create task is a success.

Now we may want to change that, but I vote, if we keep the above true, we can just add current_task = <link to task> into the instance list, and we get what we want with the task stuff.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2014-04-28 20:01:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2014-04-28 20:01:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Restored

I do think the task work I'm doing will end up superseding this, though maybe just a little. commit_message:
Return all servers from server create V3 API

The server create API currently returns only one server (the first)
even when multiple servers are requested. In V3, we can change the
API to return a list of servers.

This change returns a list of servers:

{"servers": [...]}

in the post response instead of only the first server:

{"server": {...}}.

It also removes "location" from the response as each server in the
list has links.

DocImpact

Implements blueprint return-all-servers-during-multiple-create

Change-Id: I5c833731f1516c8256f835e21cc22fd613bc57ba

commit_message:
Just use int(BOOL) to convert to 1 or 0

(This is split out from I24461f4328e188c8983ad574495e11e033ec5ba4 on
neutron, which was a hunt to remove "PRED and A or B" deprecated ternary
idiom.)

int(bool) already returns only 1 or 0 - no need to do our own explicit
version.

Change-Id: I4a26431337f746a9332beb0079e7ddf936253378

(5 comments)

So, I personally don't think we're ready for this since we don't have any readonly root working at all... and perhaps we should put a spec for that together first. I will be interested to see what other reviewers think. Obviously it can come in whether or not I'm personally keen on it - I'm a facilitator and arbitrator, not temporary dictator.

That said - wearing 'one visionary of many' hat - I suspect that this spec could have substantial technical overhead, so I'd like to see a focus on reducing that in further iterations."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-05-26 02:36:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

- gate-tripleo-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/76/94876/1/check/gate-tripleo-specs-python27/a7fdde5 : SUCCESS in 37s
- gate-tripleo-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/76/94876/1/check/gate-tripleo-specs-docs/be8818a/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 42s'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2014-05-27 19:45:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(6 comments)

i see making /mnt/state configurable as a precursor to getting to a read only root. That way, the door is open  for different read only root implementations such as rh's, or the one that TripleO is going down the road of creating where all persistent stateful data paths are explicitly reconfigured to a path under /mnt/state.

That's really the point of this spec...I want the option to s#/mnt/state## in the config templates and o-r-c scripts so that rh's systemd based readonly root support could be used as intended."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2014-05-27 19:49:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-05-27 19:53:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

- gate-tripleo-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/76/94876/6/check/gate-tripleo-specs-docs/3e9d817/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 04s'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2014-06-06 20:28:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

I'm in favor of supporting alternate readonly roots, if for no other reason than recent experience suggests our product people won't be happy supporting a non-standard way to do readonly root when we already provide a standard way to do it.

re: Juno scheduling.

can you elaborate a bit on your specific concerns? The things I'm cognizant of are:

 * reviewer workload
 * potential introduction of new bugs, obviously I'd work hard to avoid this :-)
 * the actual work to make the change as laid out in the spec, which i'll be doing

since TripleO isn't tied to the integrated OpenStack release, there's no feature freeze I'm aware of. So, I don't buy the idea that this would inhibit something else from being completed, or deprioritize someone else's work. I don't recall anyone else raising these concerns last week.

Personally, I'm concerned that there is an idea of accepting/rejecting work based on a prioritization "for Juno", since again, we aren't part of the integrated release. And further, have had no group consensus or communication on any sort of proposed feature freeze or soft freeze for TripleO.

What integrated projects are doing with -2's and their spec deadlines, etc, is largely irrelevant for TripleO IMO, except where TripleO specs may depend on other integrated project's specs that miss their own freeze.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2014-07-29 01:57:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

Re scheduling.

As for the items listed in this SPEC I'd +2 (and approve) just about anything described here regardless of whether we approve this spec for Juno or not.

I say fire away..."}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2014-07-29 20:22:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: -Code-Review

I'd add to the assessment of reviewer workload the context switching needed to track many different threads of work at once - which can lead to defects slipping in. In terms of the integrated release angle, I think there are two aspects for us - one is that our components are dependendencies of CI for the release (e.g. dib and orc for heat), secondly, many (not all) of our specs will depend on work in other projects that are locking down things. Thirdly, even though we aren't freezing in the same way the API servers do today, we will need to when Tuskar incubates. Lastly, my big concern is that we don't have a large set of approved-but-not-completed specs - keeping our group focus on a managable number of things and churning through them more quickly. We don't know our velocity yet, but we do know we're already behind on code reviews - where things are complex enough they needed explicit design review like specs, I am worried we'll do a poor job if we exceed capacity. So my -2 angle here is not about deprioritising other peoples work, but about completing the work we've already committed to."}, {'account_id': 8399, 'date': '2014-07-31 14:51:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-31 14:51:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: -Verified

lifeless, as for not running os-apply-config with the --root option, the need aiui is:

 * desire to have some set of templates rendered under /
 * desire to have some other set of templates rendered under 
   the state directory (/mnt/state as hardcoded)

To support that, I proposed an enhancement to the os-apply-config control file work that Alexis has been working on:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/113651/

The idea being that in the oac control file you can set whether the template should be rendered under the stateful path or not. This would enable us to remove the hardcoded /mnt/state directory structure from the templates that do that, and then add control files that signal to oac to write the files under the stateful directory (which will be defaulted to /mnt/state).'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-08-12 21:09:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: -Verified

'}, {'created': '2014-05-27 19:49:48.000000000', 'message': 'Configurable /mnt/state

This spec covers making the top level directory where persistent and
stateful data is written to configurable. Currently this top level path
is hardcoded to /mnt/state in our os-apply-config templates,
os-refresh-config scripts, and other element scripts.

If the path is configurable, that opens the door for different read only
root implementations when TripleO is ready for read only root. In
particular, the fedora-readonly systemd approach uses bind mounts so
that services do not need to be reconfigured at all in their
configuration files.

commit_message:
Configurable /mnt/state

This spec covers making the top level directory where persistent and
stateful data is written to configurable. Currently this top level path
is hardcoded to /mnt/state in our os-apply-config templates,
os-refresh-config scripts, and other element scripts.

Change-Id: Ifdaf31a97a76d69d89c0b5f48714cedfb3cf7b06

commit_message:
Send additional payload as part of delete event

The delete notification currently only includes the resource id.
When ceilometer looks for this event, it expects more metadata
like the ones included in create or update events. This fix
is so we include the necessary payload as part of the delete
event in neutron. There is a test_v2_api.TestNotification
testcase that covers this using mock objects.

Closes-Bug: #1315018

Change-Id: I351e79b741a1b842afc3486c067ce702160a0063

Time has moved on. A lot of work and a lot of people need to be on board for this to work.

In the past using o-r-c on reboot seemed the easiest thing to do as we where missing a lot of infrastructure that has since been added. A lot of work will need to be undone to get to using o-r-c on reboot. I could have listed the issues before that o-r-c would solve but can't now."}]

commit_message:
Force run of os-collect-config command on reboot

This enables us to handle cases where we need to assert ephemeral state.

Change-Id: I0f5811a1fe5dc40511acfbc1f1630281bc1914a2
Closes-bug: #1334804

commit_message:
Validate network config (vlan)

Validate to make sure empty physical networks
are not permitted. Added unit test as well.

Change-Id: Ie55fab3c53276ed48d5e9d603e8c1dc59fa9cc32
Closes-Bug: 1325664

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-25 01:51:26.000000000', 'message': "Attempt to re-initialize DVR flows on failure

When setup_dvr_flows_on_integ_tun_br() fails, for example,
when it cannot obtain a DVR MAC address, we disable distributed
routing for the agent and insert a local flow into the table.

Since the failure could be caused due to a transient RPC
error, change things to retry initialization in the agent's
rpc_loop() code since it might eventually succeed, at which
time we can add all the correct flows into the table.

Change-Id: I5fd9bf4163eafa321c5fca7ffb7901ae289f323b
Closes-bug: #1364215
"}, {'created': '2014-09-25 12:03:02.000000000', 'message': "L2 OVS DVR Agent to handle initial dvr rpc failure

If neutron controller is not available, but L2 Agent
was started apriori, the agent was falling back to
operate in non-dvr mode.  This was due to failure
of first rpc from dvr-enabled L2 Agent in obtaining
its unique dvr mac address from the controller.
After that it permanently operates in non-dvr mode.

This fix does two things:
a. We make the l2 agent attempt to settle down in dvr mode
(when configured to operate so) by invoking the dvr rpc
in the main rpc_loop of OVS neutron agent.
When in dvr mode all dvr flows will be configured. When
in non-dvr mode, the fix ensures that basic switching
continues to be functional.

b. We ship the current operating mode of the l2 agent in
report state.  At any point of time agent-show will
let the administrator know if an l2-agent is operating
in dvr mode (or) not.  This operating mode is carried
in 'in_distributed_mode' attribute of agent state and
is apart from the existing enable_distributed_routing
static config that is already sent in report state.

Change-Id: I5fd9bf4163eafa321c5fca7ffb7901ae289f323b
Closes-bug: #1364215

"}, {'created': '2014-10-01 01:57:03.000000000', 'message': "Change L2 OVS DVR Agent to handle initial DVR RPC failure

If the L2 Agent is started before the neutron controller
is available, it will fail to obtain its unique DVR MAC
address, and fall-back to operate in non-DVR mode
permanently.

This fix does two things:
1. Makes the L2 Agent attempt to retry DVR initialization
(when configured to operate so) by invoking the DVR flow
setup function in the main rpc_loop() of the OVS neutron agent.
When in non-DVR mode, the fix ensures that basic switching
continues to be functional.

2. Correctly obtains the current operating mode of the
L2 Agent in _report_state(), instead of only reporting
the configured state.  This operating mode is carried
in 'in_distributed_mode' attribute of agent state, and
is separate from the existing enable_distributed_routing
static config that is already sent.

Change-Id: I5fd9bf4163eafa321c5fca7ffb7901ae289f323b
Closes-bug: #1364215

commit_message:
Make L2 DVR Agent start successfully without an active neutron server

If the L2 Agent is started before the neutron controller
is available, it will fail to obtain its unique DVR MAC
address, and fall-back to operate in non-DVR mode
permanently.

This fix does two things:
1. Makes the L2 Agent attempt to retry obtaining a DVR MAC
address up to five times on initialization, which should be
enough time for RPC to be successful.  On failure, it will
fall back to non-DVR mode, ensuring that basic switching
continues to be functional.

2. Correctly obtains the current operating mode of the
L2 Agent in _report_state(), instead of only reporting
the configured state.  This operating mode is carried
in 'in_distributed_mode' attribute of agent state, and
is separate from the existing enable_distributed_routing
static config that is already sent.

Change-Id: I5fd9bf4163eafa321c5fca7ffb7901ae289f323b
Closes-bug: #1364215

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-06 18:13:58.000000000', 'message': "Update swift content

I updated the swift content in the installation guide as
follows:

1) Consolidated Identity service configuration into proxy
   service configuration section.
2) Changed initial example architecture to install the proxy
   service on the controller node instead of a separate node.
   However, I used wording that supports separate and/or
   multiple proxy services.
3) The steps to configure memcached break installations with
   horizon because the latter references 127.0.0.1 instead
   of the management network interface IP address. After
   consolidating the proxy service to a single instance on
   the controller node, it now references 127.0.0.1.
4) Changed initial example architecture to install two
   storage nodes rather than five storage nodes to reduce
   the barrier to entry for users that want to try swift.
   However, I used wording that supports additional storage
   nodes and also references the swift documentation for
   larger deployments.
5) Changed the initial example architecture to use only the
   management network instead of a separate storage/replication
   network because the original instructions didn't actually use
   the latter. Fully implementing a separate storage/replication
   network requires a considerably more complex configuration
   and eliminating it reduces the barrier to entry for users
   that want to try swift. However, I used wording that
   mentions a separate storage/replication network and also
   references the swift documentation for larger deployments.
6) The Ubuntu and RHEL/CentOS/Fedora packages include ancient
   upstream/example configuration files that contain
   deprecated/defunct options and lack options that enable
   useful features. Packages take a while to fix, so the
   instructions now pull the upstream configuration files.
7) Removed the steps to create disk labels and partitions on
   the storage nodes because a variety of methods exist and
   users should choose their own method.
8) Changed rsync to run as a standard service rather than use
   the xinetd wrapper on RHEL/CentOS/Fedora.
9) Separated account, container, and object ring creation steps
   into separate sections to improve clarity and reduce typos.
10) Reduced partition power from 18 to 10 during ring creation
    because the example architecture shouldn't scale to the higher
    value using the example architecture.
11) Changed storage node service management steps on Ubuntu to
    use 'swift-init' rather than manually starting a large
    number of services.
12) Modified file names and IDs to increase consistency with
    other content in the guide.

I recommend backporting to Juno as this chapter wasn't
functional in time for release. Also, I'm planning to
improve the diagrams in a future patch.

Change-Id: I26710efe16e8cb6ed1a20ebc70b3f6d5962536d1
Partial-Bug: #1389382
Implements: blueprint installation-guide-improvements
backport: juno

commit_message:
Update swift content

I updated the swift content in the installation guide as
follows:

1) Consolidated Identity service configuration into proxy
   service configuration section.
2) Changed initial example architecture to install the proxy
   service on the controller node instead of a separate node.
   However, I used wording that supports separate and/or
   multiple proxy services.
3) The steps to configure memcached break installations with
   horizon because the latter references 127.0.0.1 instead
   of the management network interface IP address. After
   consolidating the proxy service to a single instance on
   the controller node, it now references 127.0.0.1.
4) Changed initial example architecture to install two
   storage nodes rather than five storage nodes to reduce
   the barrier to entry for users that want to try swift.
   However, I used wording that supports additional storage
   nodes and also references the swift documentation for
   larger deployments.
5) Changed the initial example architecture to use only the
   management network instead of a separate storage/replication
   network because the original instructions didn't actually use
   the latter. Fully implementing a separate storage/replication
   network requires a considerably more complex configuration
   and eliminating it reduces the barrier to entry for users
   that want to try swift. However, I used wording that
   mentions a separate storage/replication network and also
   references the swift documentation for larger deployments.
6) The Ubuntu and RHEL/CentOS/Fedora packages include ancient
   upstream/example configuration files that contain
   deprecated/defunct options and lack options that enable
   useful features. Packages take a while to fix, so the
   instructions now pull the upstream configuration files.
7) Removed the steps to create disk labels and partitions on
   the storage nodes because a variety of methods exist and
   users should choose their own method.
8) Changed rsync to run as a standard service rather than use
   the xinetd wrapper on RHEL/CentOS/Fedora.
9) Separated account, container, and object ring creation steps
   into separate sections to improve clarity and reduce typos.
10) Reduced partition power from 18 to 10 during ring creation
    because the example architecture shouldn't scale to the higher
    value using the example architecture.
11) Changed storage node service management steps on Ubuntu to
    use 'swift-init' rather than manually starting a large
    number of services.
12) Modified file names and IDs to increase consistency with
    other content in the guide.

I recommend backporting to Juno as this chapter wasn't
functional in time for release. Also, I'm planning to
improve the diagrams in a future patch.

Change-Id: I26710efe16e8cb6ed1a20ebc70b3f6d5962536d1

commit_message:
Update fuel_plugin_example

* plugin version is 1.0.0
* remove `types`, because this field is not used
* update description
* remove install scripts because installation
  process is moved to fuel client

Change-Id: I9d31f28d2a1e0a91da4fc8278d775dd87ce3ba6d
Implements: blueprint cinder-neutron-plugins-in-fuel

commit_message:
Added the Pacemaker cookbook

Per our Dev Design Session at Openstack Summit Fall 14
We decided to move the cookbook-pacemaker into Stackforge.

This is the initial repo to make this happen.

Change-Id: I78f0c93f10df7cdb0190b2913ef415d630c18cd3

commit_message:
Mount /etc/yum.repos.d from host to storage-repo

We have to mount /etc/yum.repos.d into fuel-storage-repo container if we
want to get latest repos inside containers. Otherwise we will have
latest repos, but they won't be used.

Change-Id: I66178d44ed667e56293093d9c91c71c540a86069
Closes-Bug: #1390375

(cherry picked from commit f43179a544b2e8a628c7fff99d20daf603cdfa47)

Change-Id: I93e227ebbd99906a246b58b602f84d088e4f79ec

commit_message:
Mount /etc/yum.repos.d from host to storage-repo

We have to mount /etc/yum.repos.d into fuel-storage-repo container if we
want to get latest repos inside containers. Otherwise we will have
latest repos, but they won't be used.

Change-Id: Idf4058a95420ee57183c3c55ac988bdff861c933
Closes-Bug: #1390375

commit_message:
Fix incorrect description of AWS::CW::Alarm props

Relying on [1], there are a few errors, where property's
importance is wrong.

[1] http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-properties-cw-alarm.html

Change-Id: Iea25ff50805ea7dad39ecc1266ec584f61433210

commit_message:
Mount /etc/yum.repos.d from host to storage-repo

We have to mount /etc/yum.repos.d into fuel-storage-repo container if we
want to get latest repos inside containers. Otherwise we will have
latest repos, but they won't be used.

Change-Id: I7de729be3cb17cb13d1838b69fb964cb43248cff
Closes-Bug: #1390375

(cherry picked from commit d942738c849eca6781908d538f736d5e9b75c426)

Change-Id: I1bb0ce6fbbb58f5897b49ba4b27f46ac27b00106

commit_message:
Add a new driver to support AMT as power driver

Introduce a new driver pxe_amttool to extend ironic's range to Desktop.
AMT/vPro is widely used in Desktop to remotely control the power,
similar like IPMI.
It will use amttool as power management and pxe as deploy management.

Change-Id: Id720628adcd4b8b2bc503c2ac44278143d657271

commit_message:
Mount /etc/yum.repos.d from host to storage-repo

We have to mount /etc/yum.repos.d into fuel-storage-repo container if we
want to get latest repos inside containers. Otherwise we will have
latest repos, but they won't be used.

Change-Id: I7de729be3cb17cb13d1838b69fb964cb43248cff
Closes-Bug: #1390375

commit_message:
Mount /etc/yum.repos.d from host to storage-repo

We have to mount /etc/yum.repos.d into fuel-storage-repo container if we
want to get latest repos inside containers. Otherwise we will have
latest repos, but they won't be used.

Change-Id: I66178d44ed667e56293093d9c91c71c540a86069
Closes-Bug: #1390375

'}, {'created': '2014-11-07 11:04:33.000000000', 'message': "Decrease number of retries for puppet deployments

Default behavior before: 3 puppet runs for the
current role on the current node: 1 run + 2 retries

Now we will run only 2 times: 1 run + 1 retries

In 99 out of 100 cases, if the problem persists
when we restart puppet, it will not disappear after
next restart. That's why it makes no sense to run
more than 2 times. Thus we save time, follow the
ideology of 'fail fast', speed up deployment
process, show user more detailed message about
problem instead of 'deployment timeout'.

Change-Id: Idd4b2a2e7ecdeff9ec298a2c5ceaea91f74cee4c
Related-Bug: #1384332
DocImpact
"}]
commit_message:
Decrease number of retries for puppet deployments

Default behavior before: 3 puppet runs for the
current role on the current node: 1 run + 2 retries

Now we will run only 2 times: 1 run + 1 retries

In 99 out of 100 cases, if the problem persists
when we restart puppet, it will not disappear after
next restart. That's why it makes no sense to run
more than 2 times. Thus we save time, follow the
ideology of 'fail fast', speed up deployment
process, show user more detailed message about
problem instead of 'deployment timeout'.

Change-Id: Idd4b2a2e7ecdeff9ec298a2c5ceaea91f74cee4c
Related-Bug: #1384332
DocImpact

commit_message:
I18n

Keystoneclient didn't provide translated messages. With this
change, the messages are marked for translation.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint keystoneclient-i18n

Change-Id: I85263a71671a1dffed524185266e6bb7ae559630

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-21 19:42:03.000000000', 'message': 'Ability to flag projects to use non-standard libraries

Several jobs run requirements/update.py to check if the listed
requirements are present in the global requirements file. In the
update.py there is a capability to switch failure to a warning
if there is an environment flag NON_STANDARD_REQS introduced in
Id90547e2fb0a5736385c9f31ba386e7c2e0616df

In this review, we make sure that if the flag is specified in
the project yml file (example in
I1fb4d58a36c9a12f87527f4fb551f4b664c386bd ) then we pass that
flag long to stack.sh.

Change-Id: I32a2cd1245a6fad373870362d3399cf1397aa7f1
'}, {'created': '2014-10-27 21:02:37.000000000', 'message': "Ability to flag projects to use non-standard libraries

devstack and requirements repo are being updated in the
following changes to allow projects to specify a soft
dependency for additional libraries not specified in
global-requirements. In this review, we enable a project
to specify the flag in a project/job's yml file and
pass the flag along down to devstack

Depends-On: I4aa606514131b5dde67d87f5c8db5a3f3e50fc03
Depends-On: I1f195ef9ff1509659848e14ec9936ff6f66a6496

Change-Id: I32a2cd1245a6fad373870362d3399cf1397aa7f1
"}]
commit_message:
Ability to flag projects to use non-standard libraries

devstack and requirements repo are being updated in the
following changes to allow projects to specify a soft
dependency for additional libraries not specified in
global-requirements. In this review, we enable a project
to specify the flag in a project/job's yml file and
pass the flag along down to devstack

Depends-On: I4aa606514131b5dde67d87f5c8db5a3f3e50fc03
Depends-On: I1f195ef9ff1509659848e14ec9936ff6f66a6496

Change-Id: I32a2cd1245a6fad373870362d3399cf1397aa7f1

commit_message:
Controls improvements

 - proper selection classes
 - css hacks removal
 - removed default 'enable-selection' class - it should be added on demand per each element

Change-Id: I9ca621d671288fe0f7d8281db5fdf0275eb1eb48
Closes-bug: #1386622

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-01 19:50:35.000000000', 'message': 'Have resource CRUD return self to simplify the proxies

Instead of:
    def create_project(self, **data):
        obj = project.Project(**data)
        obj.create(self.session)
        return obj

We can:
    def create_project(self, **data):
        return project.Project(**data).create(self.session)

Change-Id: Ifbb41c7d1de461c80ea98b2c3d2e715da770a07f
'}]

commit_message:
Add CERT file support in heat-keystone-setup-domain

Add below options to support ssl connection.
--insecure
--os-cacert
--os-cert
--os-key

Change-Id: I9d1fd07df783d7410ac3f51b5d4e8434d57182a4
Close-bug: #1387063
(cherry picked from commit 8d4e7acb83add56b2105b9da2b5d263cec1d7cdd)

[{'created': '2014-10-14 19:01:25.000000000', 'message': "Specify TEMPEST_VOLUME_DRIVER for ceph

This option doesn't do anything in itself other than allow
TEMPEST_STORAGE_PROTOCOL to be set.

Change-Id: I11be9a47a8f889263275751e97810a9bba37fa74
"}]
commit_message:
Specify TEMPEST_VOLUME_DRIVER for ceph

This option doesn't do anything in itself other than allow
TEMPEST_STORAGE_PROTOCOL to be set.

Change-Id: I11be9a47a8f889263275751e97810a9bba37fa74

commit_message:
Do not merge: Security Groups  API Tests Enhancements

Add test to create security  rule
    -Create a security group rule with protocol attribute as integer value
    -Validate the security rule protocol value

just for investigating the problem of Icd967f8d25a55c3e0db57af8e764bfb0a3dab6f9

Change-Id: If88a5e01b7fddf37850281d0465e822a6557a801

commit_message:
Add wait for async secgroup add to minimum basic scenario

Security group add actions are asynchronous so we can't assume that
the security will be available immediately to ssh into the server.
This commit fixes the issue by adding a wait for the secgroup to show
up in the server before we move on.

Fixes-bug: 1390355
Change-Id: Idd561d77ce2e4b83421bb7bfb6327a6c940b62ed

Huawei OceanStor 18000-series enterprise storage system is an optimum

commit_message:
Add volume driver for Huawei 18000 storage system

Huawei OceanStor 18000-series enterprise storage system is an optimum
storage platform for next-generation data centers that feature
virtualization, hybrid cloud, simplified IT, and low carbon footprints.

This patch add an iSCSI driver and a FC driver for Huawei 18000 storage
system, using REST. We define a common module for both iSCSI driver and
FC driver.

Implements: blueprint huawei-18000-driver
Change-Id: Ied3ba32589ed78d233a588f6bcdb1cfb766449c8

commit_message:
Auto generate the API documentation

Once we use the pbr based build to generate files, we prune
the indexes to remove references to code we would like to
hide like the common modules and private modules in conf.py.
We reuse the same excluded_patterns variable that is already
used in Sphinx and filter these modules from autoindex.rst

Change-Id: I21e516a80f20eb2d5965a5a63c7dfd2d231c67e1

Ensure config changes in one test does not step on others

Safety precaution, adding a fixture that cleans up local
changes if any

Change-Id: I39867276769d766e384899356083bb63b49fd059

Role 'Cinder LVM' is enabled for LVM or VMDK driver

Fix restriction for Cinder LVM role in openstack.yaml.

messages:
[{'account_id': 12988, 'date': '2014-08-20 17:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2014-08-20 17:26:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-08-20 17:41:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. messages:
[{'account_id': 668, 'date': '2014-10-07 20:56:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2014-10-07 21:12:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

If this is a new project led by a different team than the existing Nova team, then I don't think the compute program makes sense.  I think this should be an independent stackforge project."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2014-10-07 21:12:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I thought the plan was to leave this outside of the nova program for now.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2014-10-07 21:12:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think the plan was to get this in a stackforge repo first and not an official one, right? What happened to that plan?'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2014-10-07 21:13:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

wow, sorry for 3 of us commenting at once (in the same minute).  I know we didn't mean to pile on.  We were just talking about it on IRC and didn't coordinate putting the feedback on the review."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2014-10-07 21:14:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

also not a big fan on the name magnum'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-10-07 21:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGit#Test_Failures

- gate-infra-puppet-apply-centos6 http://logs.openstack.org/25/126725/1/check/gate-infra-puppet-apply-centos6/ba15806 : SUCCESS in 3m 02s'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2014-10-08 06:06:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2014-10-13 17:47:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If this project is to be a part of the compute program, it should be in the openstack/ namespace.  If it is not part of the compute program (and is therefore not part of the OpenStack project at all for purposes of governance, legal concerns, summit time, etc.) then it should go in stackforge/.

Basically, the compute program needs to decide whether this is part of the effort it is undertaking in creating OpenStack.

Because there has been so much confusion around this, if it is decided that it should be part of the compute program, I would like to see a change to the governance repo to add this project before we merge this change.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2014-10-13 18:58:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

At this time, this should not be part of the compute program for several reasons:

* Ultimately I think this should be a separate program (under our current model), as it will most likely be a separate core team, separate service etc. Perhaps the Compute program has to change its mission slightly.
* Even if this did belong in compute program long term, In this case I don't I don't think we want to adapt something before its even written."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2014-10-15 17:08:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Right, I think that the question of whether this will ever be part of the compute program is rather moot at this point. Since it doesn't exist yet, the time between now and when we would even consider making it part of the compute program is large. Thus, I think it needs to be in stackforge until we make that call (which is what we asked for in the beginning, IIRC). If we were expecting this to be a short process, it would make sense to optimize for not creating and then renaming a repo. However, I don't think that applies here."}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2014-10-27 21:57:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I believe merging this directly into Nova without an incubation period or atleast having all the code for the nova-core to take a look is fraught with problems.

I'd really like to contribute upstream to this project, but only if it began life in the stackforge namespace without any preexisting VM-related baggage.

Let's get it there so we can start the implementation.  Let the code speak for itself."}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2014-11-06 15:15:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-06 15:21:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-07 20:56:10.000000000', 'message': 'Magnum - OpenStack Containers Service

OpenStack project for development of a new official service under the
existing Compute program for using advanced features of containers in
combination with Nova.

Change-Id: I70763a48adbd93ef920885398a03d7f6b36f7c11
'}, {'created': '2014-11-06 15:15:51.000000000', 'message': 'Magnum - OpenStack Containers Service

OpenStack project for development of a new service for using
advanced features of containers in combination with Nova.

NOTE: At the Design summit session, Nova core guidance was
to start a a new project in stackforge and evaluate later
(next summit) if this needs to be under Nova Umbrella.

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I70763a48adbd93ef920885398a03d7f6b36f7c11
'}, {'created': '2014-11-06 16:27:34.000000000', 'message': 'Magnum - OpenStack Containers Service

OpenStack project for development of a new service for using
advanced features of containers in combination with Nova.

NOTE: At the Design summit session, Nova core guidance was
to start a a new project in stackforge and evaluate later
(next summit) if this needs to be under Nova Umbrella.

commit_message:
Magnum - OpenStack Containers Service

OpenStack project for development of a new service for using
advanced features of containers in combination with Nova.

NOTE: At the Design summit session, Nova core guidance was
to start a a new project in stackforge and evaluate later
(next summit) if this needs to be under Nova Umbrella.

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I70763a48adbd93ef920885398a03d7f6b36f7c11
