commit_message:
Make _send_sensor_data more cooperative

This change adds yielding execution to other greenthreads to
_send_sensor_data periodic task to make it more cooperative.

Change-Id: I03a54ce272b6899af0a978c27bc787f106a37906

commit_message:
Add openstack_extras and epel dependency

* Required for pacemaker service provider wrappers
  implementation.
* Add Puppet-openstack_extras module which comes to replace
  puppet-openstack in upstream.
  commit sha: b0b83dbf4507db36220f9c04c68e4788109b1c4b
  Source: https://github.com/stackforge/puppet-openstack_extras
* Add a dependency epel module
  v1.0.0 db0cdeba51739e748c965974ec832acada227084
  Source: https://github.com/stahnma/puppet-module-epel

Related blueprint pacemaker-improvements

Change-Id: Ib607cd77d56e55489e2a855c7ca933b8eb9fcaee
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-14 10:46:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add a JSON loader in Angular

    In order to pass data between the server and the client without
breaking Django templating, a directive has been created which loads data from
a script tag with the type application/json. For security reason you must use
the JSONSafeEncoder for dumping the datas into the HTML in order to avoid XSS.

Change-Id: Ica3dced5470b66934eaffd68dc85fcac3612c1c9
'}, {'created': '2014-02-14 13:18:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add a JSON loader in Angular

    In order to pass data between the server and the client without
breaking Django templating, a directive has been created which loads data from
a script tag with the type application/json. For security reason you must use
the JSONSafeEncoder for dumping the datas into the HTML in order to avoid XSS.

Change-Id: Ica3dced5470b66934eaffd68dc85fcac3612c1c9
'}, {'created': '2014-02-14 13:23:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add a JSON loader in Angular

    In order to pass data between the server and the client without
breaking Django templating, a directive has been created which loads data from
a script tag with the type application/json. For security reason you must use
the JSONSafeEncoder for dumping the datas into the HTML in order to avoid XSS.

    It provides a json_angular template tag which inject JSON data in a safe
way and use an angular directive to retrieve it in the client.
    Usage is {% json_angular <object_to_dump> <id_of_the_object>%} where the
object will be dumped by horizon.utils.functions.JSONSafeEncoder and the id
could be a string or a value which will be interpolated by the django template
renderer.

Change-Id: Ica3dced5470b66934eaffd68dc85fcac3612c1c9

    Usage is {% json_angular <object_to_dump> <id_of_the_object>%} where the
object will be dumped by horizon.utils.functions.JSONSafeEncoder and the id
could be a string or a value which will be interpolated by the django template
renderer.

commit_message:
Add a JSON loader in Angular

    In order to pass data between the server and the client without
breaking Django templating, a directive has been created which loads data from
a script tag with the type application/json. For security reason you must use
the JSONSafeEncoder for dumping the datas into the HTML in order to avoid XSS.

    It provides a json_angular template tag which inject JSON data in a safe
way and use an angular directive to retrieve it in the client.
    Usage is {% json_angular <object_to_dump> <id_of_the_object>%} where the
object will be dumped by horizon.utils.functions.JSONSafeEncoder and the id
could be a string or a value which will be interpolated by the django template
renderer.

Change-Id: Ica3dced5470b66934eaffd68dc85fcac3612c1c9
Implements: blueprint horizon-angular

commit_message:
New service provider

* Rewrite pacemaker service provider
* Auto-disable basic non-ha service
* Uses p_ prefix if needed
* Look for master to start for multistate resources
* Includes debugging console and specs
* Print debug status on timeout

Related-Blueprint: pacemaker-improvements
Change-Id: I712e52acc5127f02838b88eaf99e6e63a0812897

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-21 14:51:08.000000000', 'message': "Use separate pid files for Pacemaker OCF

W/o this change, improved pacemaker provider
would not differ OS-aware service pid file from
its own one. That would make impossible to
disable OS-aware services inside pcs provider.

The solution is to separate OS-aware layer from
pacemaker OCF one for pid/run/lock files (we use
only pid files in OCF scripts):

* Unify $OCF_RESKEY_pid_default definitions with
  $HA_RSCTMP and $OCF_RESOURCE_INSTANCE varaibles
  as well
  (/usr/lib/ocf/lib/heartbeat/ocf-directories::
  ${HA_RSCTMP:=/var/run/resource-agents})

* Add separate pid directories for resources managed
  by pacemaker OCF ($HA_RSCTMP/$OCF_RESOURCE_INSTANCE/)
  and keep pid files there to distinguish them from
  OS-aware ones.

* While $HA_RSCTMP is owned by root, chown resources'
  subdirectories $OCF_RESOURCE_INSTANCE to
  $OCF_RESKEY_user to grant daemons
  write access for their pid files as well.

* For start actions of OCF scripts, add safe creation
  and chowning of aforementioned pid directories

* Add missing user/group checks for rabbitmq ocf

DocImpact
Related blueprint pacemaker-improvements

Change-Id: I7f50e32ced83af8f32fd7907cb5fc723055da121
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

W/o this change, improved pacemaker provider
would not differ OS-aware service pid file from
its own one. That would make impossible to
disable OS-aware services inside pcs provider.

The solution is to separate OS-aware layer from
pacemaker OCF one for pid/run/lock files (we use
only pid files in OCF scripts):

* Unify $OCF_RESKEY_pid_default definitions with
  $HA_RSCTMP and $__SCRIPT_NAME varaibles
  as well
  (/usr/lib/ocf/lib/heartbeat/ocf-directories::
  ${HA_RSCTMP:=/var/run/resource-agents})

* Add separate pid directories for resources managed
  by pacemaker OCF ($HA_RSCTMP/$__SCRIPT_NAME/)
  and keep pid files there to distinguish them from
  OS-aware ones.

* While $HA_RSCTMP is owned by root, chown resources'
  subdirectories $__SCRIPT_NAME to
  $OCF_RESKEY_user to grant daemons
  write access for their pid files as well.

* For start actions of OCF scripts, add safe creation
  and chowning of aforementioned pid directories

* Add missing user/group checks for rabbitmq ocf

DocImpact
Related blueprint pacemaker-improvements

Change-Id: I7f50e32ced83af8f32fd7907cb5fc723055da121
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
"}, {'created': '2014-10-29 15:51:49.000000000', 'message': 'Use separate pid files for Pacemaker OCF

W/o this change, improved pacemaker provider
would not differ OS-aware service pid file from
its own one. That would make impossible to
disable OS-aware services inside pcs provider.

The solution is to separate OS-aware layer from
pacemaker OCF one for pid/run/lock files (we use
only pid files in OCF scripts):

* Unify $OCF_RESKEY_pid_default definitions with
  $HA_RSCTMP and "p_$__SCRIPT_NAME" varaibles
  as well
  (/usr/lib/ocf/lib/heartbeat/ocf-directories::
  ${HA_RSCTMP:=/var/run/resource-agents})

* p_ prefix is required due to resources naming
  conventions we use in Fuel

* Add separate pid directories for resources managed
  by pacemaker OCF ($HA_RSCTMP/$__SCRIPT_NAME/)
  and keep pid files there to distinguish them from
  OS-aware ones.

* While $HA_RSCTMP is owned by root, chown resources'
  subdirectories $__SCRIPT_NAME to
  $OCF_RESKEY_user to grant daemons
  write access for their pid files as well.

* For start actions of OCF scripts, add safe creation
  and chowning of aforementioned pid directories

* Add missing user/group checks for rabbitmq ocf

DocImpact
Related blueprint pacemaker-improvements

Change-Id: I7f50e32ced83af8f32fd7907cb5fc723055da121
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

'}, {'created': '2014-10-30 16:34:28.000000000', 'message': 'Use separate pid files for Pacemaker OCF

W/o this change, improved pacemaker provider
would not differ OS-aware service pid file from
its own one. That would make impossible to
disable OS-aware services inside pcs provider.

The solution is to separate OS-aware layer from
pacemaker OCF one for pid/run/lock files (we use
only pid files in OCF scripts):

* Unify $OCF_RESKEY_pid_default definitions with
  $HA_RSCTMP and "$__SCRIPT_NAME" varaibles
* Add separate pid directories for resources managed
  by pacemaker OCF ($HA_RSCTMP/$__SCRIPT_NAME/)
  and keep pid files there to distinguish them from
  OS-aware ones.
* While $HA_RSCTMP is owned by root, chown resources'
  subdirectories $__SCRIPT_NAME to
  $OCF_RESKEY_user to grant daemons
  write access for their pid files as well.
* For status actions of OCF scripts, add safe creation
  and chowning of aforementioned pid directories
* Add missing user/group checks for rabbitmq ocf
* Add debug for pid file related actoins
* Make empty pidfile checks
* Fix pidfile creation on start action of neutron
  agents and rabbitmq OCF
* Fix pidfile deletion on stop action for mysql OCF
* Add missing pid file checks for rabbitmq status
  and update report not running conditions

DocImpact
Related blueprint pacemaker-improvements

Change-Id: I7f50e32ced83af8f32fd7907cb5fc723055da121
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

  $HA_RSCTMP and "$__SCRIPT_NAME" varaibles
* Add separate pid directories for resources managed
  by pacemaker OCF ($HA_RSCTMP/$__SCRIPT_NAME/)
  and keep pid files there to distinguish them from
  OS-aware ones.
* While $HA_RSCTMP is owned by root, chown resources'
  subdirectories $__SCRIPT_NAME to
  $OCF_RESKEY_user to grant daemons
  write access for their pid files as well.
* For status actions of OCF scripts, add safe creation
  and chowning of aforementioned pid directories
* Add missing user/group checks for rabbitmq ocf
* Add debug for pid file related actoins
* Make empty pidfile checks
* Fix pidfile creation on start action of neutron
  agents OCF
* Fix pidfile deletion on stop action for mysql OCF

commit_message:
Use separate pid files for Pacemaker OCF

W/o this change, improved pacemaker provider
would not differ OS-aware service pid file from
its own one. That would make impossible to
disable OS-aware services inside pcs provider.

The solution is to separate OS-aware layer from
pacemaker OCF one for pid/run/lock files (we use
only pid files in OCF scripts):

* Unify $OCF_RESKEY_pid_default definitions with
  $HA_RSCTMP and "$__SCRIPT_NAME" varaibles
* Add separate pid directories for resources managed
  by pacemaker OCF ($HA_RSCTMP/$__SCRIPT_NAME/)
  and keep pid files there to distinguish them from
  OS-aware ones.
* While $HA_RSCTMP is owned by root, chown resources'
  subdirectories $__SCRIPT_NAME to
  $OCF_RESKEY_user to grant daemons
  write access for their pid files as well.
* For status actions of OCF scripts, add safe creation
  and chowning of aforementioned pid directories
* Add missing user/group checks for rabbitmq ocf
* Add debug for pid file related actoins
* Make empty pidfile checks
* Fix pidfile creation on start action of neutron
  agents OCF
* Fix pidfile deletion on stop action for mysql OCF

DocImpact
Related blueprint pacemaker-improvements

Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: I7f50e32ced83af8f32fd7907cb5fc723055da121
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Remove old basic service_disables

* Remove *_stopped/*_disabled services definitions
  * RabbitMQ
  * Heat Engine
  * Galera
* Use clear titles for services and use name if service
  name should be changed (e.g from params.pp)
* Fix mangling for corosync services.

Related to blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: Iedd11984f43f0d653526113ac208470aa4f39a94

commit_message:
Fix WSGI unittests on systems without IPv6

Test test_start_random_port_with_ipv6 and test_app_using_ipv6_and_ssl
fail when IPv6 is either disabled or not available on the system.
This patch skips the test if the wsgi server can't be started due
to ipv6 address assignment error.

Closes-Bug: 1174404
Change-Id: I5ada25ca6ba191a566a45bfba1a6703db09f273e

commit_message:
Propose: Add cinder volume drivers for Violin Memory storage arrays

A new set of Cinder drivers are required to support Violin Memory
storage arrays.  Both ISCSI and Fibrechannel should be supported.  The
design would be very similar to other SAN-type devices from other
contributors.

Related to blueprint violinmemory-v6000-storage-drivers

Change-Id: I918550782d11cfab72ad7b8951f88a14a8942633

commit_message:
Improve shell cmds and logging in 'delete_vips'

Get rid of piping to 'grep' in 'ip_address_show'
method and fix issues with logging.

Change-Id: Icbfba0fce437001ba9c4c6c07a0811f49654dfd5
Closes-bug: #1390159

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-06 14:40:36.000000000', 'message': 'create magnum repository

The magnum team has proposed creating a repository for their
service. The nova-core team would like the containers working group to
have their own repository to prove out what they are doing. The team
is not yet ready to own this in the compute program until something is
proved out. However the high likelihood of it coming into the compute
program in the near term makes stackforge a very odd place to put it.

Thus openstack/magnum

Change-Id: Ifa1036f84e58140c376f93ce3ef19e192396a9d0
'}, {'created': '2014-11-06 15:01:19.000000000', 'message': 'create magnum repository

Magnum is a containers service. It will probably not be part of the
compute program (whether or not programs even exist in 6 months). The
team behind this believes they are blocked making progress until they
have access to a gerrit repo.

Change-Id: Ifa1036f84e58140c376f93ce3ef19e192396a9d0
'}, {'created': '2014-11-06 16:06:52.000000000', 'message': 'create magnum repository

Magnum is a containers service. It will probably not be part of the
compute program (whether or not programs even exist in 6 months). The

Change-Id: Ifa1036f84e58140c376f93ce3ef19e192396a9d0
'}]
commit_message:
create magnum repository

Magnum is a containers service. It will probably not be part of the
compute program (whether or not programs even exist in 6 months). The
team behind this believes they are blocked making progress until they
have access to a gerrit repo.

Change-Id: Ifa1036f84e58140c376f93ce3ef19e192396a9d0

host to get it back, Nova will call init_host() and then

_destroy_evacuated_instances(), nova will check again if
the storage is shared or not to decide if the storage
should be destroyed. Now nova is using temp file to check
if it's shared file system, but it's wrong for RBD case.

which will fail since it's used by the new instance. This

commit_message:
Fix nova-compute start issue after evacuate

After evacuated successfully, and restarting the failed
host to get it back, Nova will call init_host() and then
call method _destroy_evacuated_instances(). In method
_destroy_evacuated_instances(), nova will check again if
the storage is shared or not to decide if the storage
should be destroyed. Now nova is using temp file to check
if it's shared file system, but it's wrong for RBD case.
So Nova will attempt to delete the shared block storage,
which will fail since it's used by the new instance. This
patch fixes this issue and adds test cases for that.

Closes-Bug: 1385484

Change-Id: I71bb818f3c2930b3a2ddf1817dfd4bb61fae7e98

commit_message:
Add ability to compare two verification results

Currently there is no built-in way in Rally to see the differences
between two verification runs. This feature adds a compare sub-command
to rally verify that takes two verification IDs as input and output the
differences between two verifications in the desired format, html, csv,
json or pprint. Output may be printed to std out or directed to file
destination specified.

Tasks
- Add compare sub-command to rally verify.
- Add ability to specify output format and file name of comparison
  report.
  Initial support will allow for output to either HTML, pretty print
  or CSV.
- Create rally/verification/verifiers/tempest/diff.py that handles all
  the comparing and output of results.
- Create required mako template (compare.mako) and renderer
  (compare2html.py) class for HTML output.
- Added percentage threshold argument for determining execution time
  differences

Change-Id: I0276e431d7d1ad89b1b28306cd0e0ea7e1174217
Implements: blueprint tempest-compare

When we click a delete button in network topology, the corresponding

commit_message:
Confirm Dialog for Delete operation in Network Topology

When we click a delete button in network topology, the corresponding
delete operation is issued immediately. Now, a confirm dialog is
displayed first to confirm the user's action and then the item gets
deleted accordingly. It brings better consistency with delete
operations of other tables.

Change-Id: I2d6d2aab092d99ab536c84b56fb79a2dac37fd9a
Closes-Bug: #1242251

commit_message:
Add unit tests for iscsi.py

There is no unit test for cinder/volume/targets/iscsi.py.
Here I add some test cases.

Change-Id: I51e625957827e7e7f03c31232094c8993571744b

Fixed exception handling in test_delete_nonexistent_snapshot

test_delete_nonexistent_snapshot checks the exception at incorrect
part in test code.
This patch fix it.

commit_message:
Validate nested stacks for resource groups

Currently we don't fail fast, even if there is no
resource type mapping in the nested template
which should fail validation.

This change will to recurse and do static template
validation both for OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup and
OS::Heat::ResourceGroup.

Closes-Bug: #1389104
Change-Id: I7accc3c0f121e238f915a92bbd209b7ec11533a7

- check-devstack-dsvm-cells http://logs.openstack.org/64/125864/1/check/check-devstack-dsvm-cells/4d9e8b8 : SUCCESS in 14m 23s'}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2014-10-08 06:38:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Jay, thanks for your work on this, I like the general idea on this.

However, the size of the try..except blocks is too large to me, and there is only a "except Exception", which simply catches everything. Thus if there is an exception raised somewhere else this might lead to a wrong error message.

I think it would be nice to have smaller try..except blocks, and to try to catch known exceptions first. For example, os.listdir raises only OSError (afaik), so this might be a an alternative:

 try:
     dirs = os.listdir(something)
 except OSError as e:
     ... do something here 

Thus adding a -1 for now.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2014-10-10 15:24:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Christian,

Thanks for the feedback.  Makes sense.  I will work on getting the suggestions addressed.

Jay'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2014-10-10 15:25:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2014-10-23 23:15:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(7 comments)

Thanks for this - some comments inline, but my main concern is that I could not reproduce the fork bomb reported in the related bug. 

I think the difference here is that exceptions raised in the child processes are not caught, so the child terminates, whereas in the object auditor all exceptions were caught and squashed, so the child process re-entered the 'while True' loop and forked another child.

What I did see (and what this patch fixes) is that the updater will terminate if permission is denied to list the device path. With this change the error is logged and the updater continues to loop, so a restart is not needed if the permissions are fixed.

Assuming my analysis is correct i.e. orphaned processes are not created, the commit message should be changed."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2014-10-24 19:06:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(6 comments)

Alistair,

Thank you for all the good comments and suggestions.  I am wondering if you couldn't reproduce the fork bomb as the patch to fix that already merged.

Anyway, I will update this commit message as this has really become its own fix."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2014-10-24 19:21:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2014-10-24 19:25:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-10-24 20:32:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-03 02:58:38.000000000', 'message': 'Handle os.listdir failures in container-updater

While investigating bug 1375348 I discovered the problem
reported there was not limited to the object-auditor.  The
container-updated has similar bugs.

This patch catches the unhandled exception that can be thrown by
os.listdir.  This required instrumenting the get_paths function to
handle exceptions thrown from os.listdir.  The patch also catches
exceptions in the run_forever() function so that we can ensure that
sys.exit() is always called in the child.  Without this change,
we can end up with orphaned processes in the same manner as is
documented in bug 1375348.

Change-Id: I7eed122bf6b663e6e7894ace136b6f4653db4985
Related-bug: 1375348

commit_message:
Handle os.listdir failures in container-updater

While investigating bug 1375348 I discovered the problem
reported there was not limited to the object-auditor.  The
container-updated has similar bugs.

This patch catches the unhandled exception that can be thrown by
os.listdir.

Change-Id: I7eed122bf6b663e6e7894ace136b6f4653db4985
Related-bug: 1375348

Let's use the full project name to avoid confusion with the recently added
Swiftbrowser based on AngularJS.

Change-Id: Ib07338268a1593bc2882908b49c1fb4a130ff43d

commit_message:
Rename Swiftbrowser in associated projects

Let's use the full project name to avoid confusion with the recently added
Swiftbrowser based on AngularJS.

Change-Id: Ib07338268a1593bc2882908b49c1fb4a130ff43d

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-04 16:16:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add default_volume_type to cinder config

This allows the administrator of a cloud with multiple backends to
define which volume is the default when a user creats a volume without
specifying a volume type.

Change-Id: I1bb94dc1283e50645e4aece600acc52ae17db56b
Co-Authored-By: Craige McWhirter <craige.mcwhirter@anchor.com.au>
Closes-Bug: #1389292
'}]
commit_message:
Add default_volume_type to cinder config

This allows the administrator of a cloud with multiple backends to
define which volume is the default when a user creats a volume without
specifying a volume type.

Change-Id: I1bb94dc1283e50645e4aece600acc52ae17db56b
Co-Authored-By: Craige McWhirter <craige.mcwhirter@anchor.com.au>
Closes-Bug: #1389292

Clean up index page

There were a lot of artifacts left from the HTML translation.

The toctree at the end is to suppress the errors until the remaining
docs are cleaned up.

commit_message:
Update help text for netapp_server_port option

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/128700/ merged upstream in Kilo last
night; this change is a result of running the autohelp-wrapper from
openstack-doc-tools on the master branch of cinder.

Change-Id: I1eb4ebb7e819e62d0d956f853f0f77265d07016e

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-28 15:01:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes DOS issue in instance list ip filter

Converts the ip filtering to filter the list locally based
on the network info cache instead of making an extremely expensive
call over to nova network where it attempts to retrieve a list
of every instance in the system.

Change-Id: I455f6ab4acdecacc5152b11a183027f933dc4475
Closes-bug: #1358583
(cherry picked from commit 24c8cc53fd6a62fcad1287b2cdcf32d2ff0991d9)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes DOS issue in instance list ip filter

Converts the ip filtering to filter the list locally based
on the network info cache instead of making an extremely expensive
call over to nova network where it attempts to retrieve a list
of every instance in the system.

Change-Id: I455f6ab4acdecacc5152b11a183027f933dc4475
Closes-bug: #1358583
(cherry picked from commit 24c8cc53fd6a62fcad1287b2cdcf32d2ff0991d9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-28 15:01:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes DOS issue in instance list ip filter

Converts the ip filtering to filter the list locally based
on the network info cache instead of making an extremely expensive
call over to nova network where it attempts to retrieve a list
of every instance in the system.

Change-Id: I455f6ab4acdecacc5152b11a183027f933dc4475
Closes-bug: #1358583
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes DOS issue in instance list ip filter

Converts the ip filtering to filter the list locally based
on the network info cache instead of making an extremely expensive
call over to nova network where it attempts to retrieve a list
of every instance in the system.

Change-Id: I455f6ab4acdecacc5152b11a183027f933dc4475
Closes-bug: #1358583

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-05 21:00:44.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: disk_info should be passed to _create_domain_and_network

In order to start LXC instances, disk_info should be passed
to _create_domain_and_network for it to determinine if the instance
has been started from an Image or a Volume.

Updating hard_reboot as well finish_migration
and finish_revert_migration

Change-Id: I9a43e1f919b554b56cd9eb688cd0ed3dec03c959
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: disk_info should be passed to _create_domain_and_network

In order to start LXC instances, disk_info should be passed
to _create_domain_and_network for it to determinine if the instance
has been started from an Image or a Volume.

Updating hard_reboot as well finish_migration
and finish_revert_migration

Change-Id: I9a43e1f919b554b56cd9eb688cd0ed3dec03c959

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-29 22:50:41.000000000', 'message': 'scheduler: Remove assert on the exact number of weighers

Since the weighers code is by design pluggable, downstream packagers may have
added additional weigher classes, causing this assert to fail.

Rather than require downstream maintain a patch against this line, the
proposal is to remove it since the asserts after it are sufficient.

Change-Id: I13765fae188af92a2e729dcd14caf981db01acb4
'}]
commit_message:
scheduler: Remove assert on the exact number of weighers

Since the weighers code is by design pluggable, downstream packagers may have
added additional weigher classes, causing this assert to fail.

Rather than require downstream maintain a patch against this line, the
proposal is to remove it since the asserts after it are sufficient.

Change-Id: I13765fae188af92a2e729dcd14caf981db01acb4

commit_message:
Fix instance_usage_audit_log test to use admin context

Nova V2 API 'os-instance_usage_audit_log' is for admin only
and Nova policy.json has rule for the same But
test_instance_usage_audit_log tests this API as non admin.

This patch fix test_instance_usage_audit_log test to use admin
context.

Also adding some more tests to verify this API with non-admin context.

Closes-Bug: #1387901

Change-Id: I20a477786ef0f3e1132629c4a12af40524e2b09f

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-20 17:47:39.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: report hugepages topology to host_state

Introduce a new method _get_host_hugepages_topology to
report pages topology to host_state.

Work-Item: Enhance libvirt driver to report available
           large pages per NUMA node in the host state data

Partial-Implement: blueprint virt-driver-large-pages

Change-Id: I392bdc45aa3b6b169c1d1bfdada624a16c77c91c
'}, {'created': '2014-10-21 08:46:22.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: report hugepages topology to host_state

Introduce a new method _get_host_hugepages_topology to
report pages topology to host_state.

Work-Item: Enhance libvirt driver to report available
           large pages per NUMA node in the host state data

commit_message:
object: update instance numa object to handle pagesize

Work-item: Enhance libvirt driver to report available
           large pages per NUMA node in the host state data

Partial-Implement: blueprint virt-driver-large-pages
Change-Id: I392bdc45aa3b6b169c1d1bfdada624a16c77c91c

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-09 14:01:02.000000000', 'message': "hardward: make numa toplogy cell usage to handle memory pages

Update VirtNUMATopologyCellUsage to introduce argument
'mempages_usage' which handles information about guest usage
of memory pages.

Work-Item: Enhance libvirt driver to report available
           large pages per NUMA node in the host state data

Partial-Implement: blueprint virt-driver-large-pages
Change-Id: Ib8772bff16f6ba58a6266a2ef40b9d81b1d7f00a
"}, {'created': '2014-10-10 11:20:17.000000000', 'message': "hardware: make cell topology to handle memory pages

Introduce argument 'mempages' which take into account memory
information about pages available for a particular cell. Also
update driver to report the information.

Work-Item: Enhance libvirt driver to report available
           large pages per NUMA node in the host state data

Partial-Implement: blueprint virt-driver-large-pages
Change-Id: Ib8772bff16f6ba58a6266a2ef40b9d81b1d7f00a

commit_message:
hardware: make cell instance topology to handle memory pages

Updates VirtNUMATopologyCellInstance to take into account
account pagesize information

Work-Item: Enhance libvirt driver to report available
           large pages per NUMA node in the host state data

Partial-Implement: blueprint virt-driver-large-pages
Change-Id: Ib8772bff16f6ba58a6266a2ef40b9d81b1d7f00a

commit_message:
hardware: introduce VirtNUMATopologyCellInstance

Introduces a new class VirtNUMATopologyCellInstance which extends
VirtNUMATopologyCell used to handle cells of VirtNUMAInstanceTopology
Also this commit make VirtNUMATopologyCell an abstract class.

Work-item: Enhance libvirt driver to report available
           large pages per NUMA node in the host state data

Change-Id: Icac19c17caec98ae31c039a2b22a7c1de546d9a2
Partial-Implement: blueprint virt-driver-large-pages

hardware: fix in doctstring the memory unit used

The unit used to handle memory is MiB not KiB

Change-Id: I49de12d0011cff8e4465759d17b502a821bb9740

Updates VirtNUMATopologyCell to introduce argument 'mempages'
which take into account memory information about pages available
for a particular cell.

Work-Item: Enhance libvirt driver to report available
           large pages per NUMA node in the host state data

Partial-Implement: blueprint virt-driver-large-pages

commit_message:
virt: introduce types VirtPageSize and VirtPagesTopology

Introduces a new types VirtPageSize and VirtPagesTopology

Work-item: Enhance libvirt driver to report available
           large pages per NUMA node in the host state data

Change-Id: I4a52bd204930245bd0539210a7f703efdeb06542
Partial-Implement: blueprint virt-driver-large-pages

commit_message:
First set of functional tests for orders

Adding the first set of functional tests for orders, plus supporting
changes to models and additional utility functions in test.utils.

Change-Id: I0f461b23d3256c3b158cedc414bb0cc6b087ff7e

messages:
[{'account_id': 13800, 'date': '2014-11-03 20:23:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2014-11-03 20:24:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-03 21:26:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

commit_message:
WIP - Conductor remotely claim resource

Currently the conductor has to rpc to the compute node for prep_resize
because the resource claim can't be achieved remotely.

With the changes of the resource remote claim, update the conductor
to use it.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint persistent-resource-claim

Change-Id: Ib096b3fe4eae71c3ce28f18d587ea3c5e917eaab

commit_message:
Change resource tracker for remote claim

Change the resource tracker to support remote claim. We keep the
original context-based return value, and add a new interface to claim
and abort claim.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint persistent-resource-claim

Change-Id: Ib198dba67abdaedc4157fdb4edd7eba9b8d46c51

subject: Keep claim information in resource tracker

commit_message:
Keep claim information in resource tracker

Currently in resource claim, the resource tracker return the claim
as context manager, but does not keep any claim information.

This patch change the resource tracker to keep the resource claim
locally in memory and track the resource usage base on the claim.

The initial resource claim information is collected when
update_available_resources() is invoked the first time.

The overall audit process is still based on instance and migration, we
can update it in future to be based purely on claim.

Implements: blueprint persistent-resource-claim

Change-Id: I265f87db9c9197e868e5b4d047f578de9b9b8625

subject: Add persistent claims support

commit_message:
Add persistent claims support

An api is provided to persist claims to storage, and provides
a driver implementation to persist the claims information in local
sqlite DB.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint persistent-resource-claim

Change-Id: I779ebe191d64e3bb5f99541aa360f47a0c2e937e

subject: Replace pci_stat's extra_info with phys_function

(2 comments)

The -1 is for the test coverage - the patch removes extra_info and adds phys_function as keys in the members of pci_stats. Strictly speaking it should allow for extra_info being in the data structure received from the database and deal with it or at least demonstrate the expected behavior if it is there but not used.

I am not too concerned about my comment on the field type used for pci_stats because the compute_nodes table is likely to be taken over by the scheduler library soon as part of the scheduler split.'}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2014-07-01 23:27:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

@Paul, I'm not sure if we will remove the compute node table in the end, and even if so, I'd suggest to keep the compute_node object in nova/compute_node, and the conductor will talk to the schedule client. If we finish the objectify of the compute-node, that will make things much easier."}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2014-07-01 23:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-01 23:49:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

The work for this patch is invalid anymore ,because the 'extra_info' has been removed from the pci_stats. I'm really not sure if it's a good idea to not keep the phys_function out of the pci_stats, but since it has been removed, then the patch is really meaningless."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-25 00:43:25.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the extra_info from pci_stats pool_keys

Currently the pci_stats is created based on
(vendor_id, product_id, extra_info), this is not good
because:

a) It keeps the pci_stats as dict of dict, i.e. a value in the
dict can be a dict still, this is complex for object,
b) extra_info would combine several PCI device properties as planned,
we should abstract the pci_stats based on device properties, instead
of the overall extra_info.

This patch removes the extra_info from the pool_keys and provides a
configuration item, so that user can specify any pci device property
contained in the extra_info.

This should have no upgrade issue because the pci_stats is created on
compute node and consumed by scheduler node. Between the upgrade of
scheduler node and compute nodes, PCI device allocation request may fail,
but that failure is temp and will be back as soon as any compute node is
upgraded.

Change-Id: I9f8d89787480132c34daf4c6d69e358354ec3621
Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
'}, {'created': '2014-04-16 21:38:44.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the extra_info from pci_stats pool_keys

'}, {'created': '2014-06-19 22:06:42.000000000', 'message': 'Change the pci_stats to support compute node object

Change compute node object to include pci_stats. The pci_stats field is list
of dicts, the value in the dict item is a string.

However, currently the pci_stats include the extra_info, which itself is
a dict. Thus the extra_info in the pci_stats is changed to be phys_function,
which is the only item in the extra_specs now. The corresponding pci_alias
configuration should be changed to use phys_function.

This should have no upgrade issue because the pci_stats is created on
compute node and consumed by scheduler node. Between the upgrade of
scheduler node and compute nodes, PCI device allocation request may fail,
but that failure is temp and will be back as soon as compute node is
upgraded.

Implements: blueprint make-resource-tracker-use-objects

DocImpact

Change-Id: I9f8d89787480132c34daf4c6d69e358354ec3621

commit_message:
Replace pci_stat's extra_info with phys_function

Currently the pci_stats include the extra_info, which is
a dict, thus it's difficult to change pci_stats as object.
Change it to be phys_function, which is the only item
in the extra_info now. The corresponding pci_alias
configuration should be changed to use phys_function.

This should have no upgrade issue because the pci_stats is created by
compute node and consumed by scheduler node. Between the upgrade of
scheduler node and compute nodes, PCI device allocation request may fail,
but that failure is temp and will be back as soon as compute node is
upgraded.

Implements: blueprint make-resource-tracker-use-objects

Change-Id: I9f8d89787480132c34daf4c6d69e358354ec3621

Any test dealing with state would have to be a separate project. So using a new keystone project / auth in order to run a test that is concerned with state.

So we need to determine the keystone users for functional tests per project so that the state will stay the same as the test runs.

so paging tests like : test_secrets_get_default_find_single_created_secret may or may not work depending on what the state is. We will need to do more research for this.. This is why it is failing in dev stack -- as it runs, it is shared w/ other tests and the results will change as the loop runs.'}, {'account_id': 9234, 'date': '2014-11-06 16:28:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

There are issues that this test brought out with running parallel tests (which is how it works in the gate, not when you run locally).

For paging tests we're going to need to be able to dynamically create a new user (meaning a new tenant too), use that user for the particular test, then never use that user again.

Good post-Paris work item."}, {'account_id': 11970, 'date': '2014-11-06 16:48:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-06 17:06:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified-1

commit_message:
The last round of secrets functional tests

This is the last round for functional tests for secrets.
This includes all data driven and paging functional tests.
The tests are tagged for negative or positive tests to
make for faster running or logical test runs for groups.
Removed paging tests due to timing issues with loops.
The tests cannot be run in parallel so will have to be
completed separately.

Change-Id: I532ebf41643ff871ff1f2d8aa476cf6e6655baa6

This change enables sudo command logging, using sudo built in debug flags.
Every 'sudo' command is now logged in below format to /var/log/sudo_debug.
Format example:
    Nov  4 18:39:21 sudo[1850] executed /bin/chmod, pid 1851

commit_message:
Record actions performed as root via sudo

This change enables sudo command logging for devstack installation time only,
using sudo built in debug flags.
Every 'sudo' command is now logged in below format to /var/log/sudo_debug.
Format example:
    Nov  4 18:39:21 sudo[1850] executed /bin/chmod, pid 1851
    Nov  4 18:39:21 sudo[1851] exec /bin/chmod [chmod 0755 /opt/stack]

This can help troubleshoot and understand how devstack works and what it does.

Change-Id: Ib2dba924e63c8df896d9967e71f3c9c291493bbd

[{'created': '2014-11-04 18:56:16.000000000', 'message': 'Upgrade to avoid vulnerable requests-kerberos versions

All versions of requests-kerberos prior to 0.6 do not properly handle
mutual authentication. In short this means that the server was never
properly verified and a client could potentially send sensitive data to
an untrusted server.

Change-Id: I1e9a3b1af15e69ae5c155a146638774cf472ef33
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrade to avoid vulnerable requests-kerberos versions

All versions of requests-kerberos prior to 0.6 do not properly handle
mutual authentication. In short this means that the server was never
properly verified and a client could potentially send sensitive data to
an untrusted server.

[{'created': '2014-04-01 19:40:32.000000000', 'message': 'client-side pagination and sorting across pages

This is a work-in-progress.

To see the pager in action, the # items per table > # Item Per Page (set via Settings > Items Per Page)

Notes:
1. using jquery.tablesorter.pager.js, a small ext of tablesorter plugin we are currently using to sort
downloaded from here: http://tablesorter.com/addons/pager/jquery.tablesorter.pager.js
2. Tables with marker API supported pagination (i.e. Admin > Instances, Admin > Projects) still function the same way as before
3. Items Per Page value in dropdown is set via Settings Page

*Have to hook filter search to work with the pager.

This will address bugs: #1212174, #1279498, #1282987, #1263142

Change-Id: Iabc3e998c3bdbc2fd02ee7e5e93bfeea195ac5f2

(set via Settings)

have api support, it is not *replacing* the currently api-supported pagination.
This will help provide consistency.
3. Takes the Items Per Page value from Settings
4. Filter search works with the pager as well

commit_message:
fallback client-side pagination, sorting across pages

Client-side pagination will only work for tables where the API
doesn't support pagination.

Tables with marker API supported pagination (e.g Admin > Instance,
Admin > Project) *still* function the same way as before.  This patch
provides a fallback/bridge feature gap for tables that don't have api
support, it is not *replacing* anything.

To see the pager in action, the # items per table > # Item Per Page
(set via Settings)

Notes:
1. uses jquery.tablesorter.pager.js, an ext of tablesorter plugin
we are currently using to sort downloaded from here:
http://mottie.github.io/tablesorter/addons/pager/jquery.tablesorter.pager.js
(included in static file package we plan to use in future - xstatic - so
no overhead)
2. This will help provide consistency.
3. Takes the Items Per Page value from Settings
4. Filter search works with the pager as well

Partial-Bug: #1263142

Change-Id: Iabc3e998c3bdbc2fd02ee7e5e93bfeea195ac5f2
Implements: blueprint client-side-pagination

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-30 20:50:59.000000000', 'message': "LIO: Fix UnboundLocalError in ensure_export

If db.volume_get() fails here, volume_info (and chap_auth)
are unbound, and the below usages will fail.

volume_get() failing is the only way to land in the NotFound
handler, so just remove this debug line.  It won't ever have
info to print.

Move code not related to db lookup out of this try block, and
return when NotFound occurs.

Closes-Bug: #1387866

Change-Id: I13a88bec1a66d8a0794b08514cc9844d60f6c809
"}]
commit_message:
LIO: Fix UnboundLocalError in ensure_export

If db.volume_get() fails here, volume_info (and chap_auth)
are unbound, and the below usages will fail.

volume_get() failing is the only way to land in the NotFound
handler, so just remove this debug line.  It won't ever have
info to print.

Move code not related to db lookup out of this try block, and
return when NotFound occurs.

Closes-Bug: #1387866

Change-Id: I13a88bec1a66d8a0794b08514cc9844d60f6c809

commit_message:
Update Telemetry config reference

The Telemetry config reference is updated by using the doc tools
script. New config options are added to the existing tables following
the current grouping of options. Flagmappings are also updated with the
new options.

Change-Id: Ia1172727879dd8dc71b0492a54a865fcc87b4064

commit_message:
Move require.js config to a separate file

so it can be reused by 3rd-party libraries like Intern or Karma

Change-Id: Idc9727e6ee28aba95abe95082f4bab63820cd5b2

commit_message:
Logging of predeployment check tasks added

* Action logs collection and update are added for several more tasks
* Download release fake is removed (obsolete, for RH)
* Tasks logging is moved to _call_silently()

Implements: blueprint send-anon-usage
Related-Bug: 1384631

Change-Id: Ic37e2efd10409b5fb70e66db846581bfed369c08

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-05 13:58:40.000000000', 'message': "Add 'pre' and 'post' phase scripts

Upstream scripts are not always 100% ready to be used in
private infra environment. Thus it's common to have own version
of the scripts with modifications. Adding two 'hooks' in
prepare_node.sh helps to make it more flexible, and get rid of
modifications of upstream version of the script,
moving those to separate files.

pre.sh might be used for setting environment variables and
running specfic node preparation tasks.

post.sh might be used to run specific post-install tasks, like
installing additional sofware, clean up, and so on.

Change-Id: Ic69d4532a566a8e3071817d644fbb88de71eea0b
"}, {'created': '2014-11-06 10:37:08.000000000', 'message': "Add 'pre' and 'post' phase scripts

of the scripts with modifications. Adding two 'hooks' in
prepare_node.sh helps to make it more flexible, and get rid of

moving those to separate files.

running specfic node preparation tasks.

Change-Id: Ic69d4532a566a8e3071817d644fbb88de71eea0b
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'pre' and 'post' phase scripts

Upstream scripts are not always 100% ready to be used in
private infra environment. Thus it's common to have own version
of the scripts with modifications. Adding two 'hooks' in
prepare_node.sh helps to make it more flexible, and get rid of
modifications of upstream version of the script,
moving those to separate files.

pre.sh might be used for setting environment variables and
running specfic node preparation tasks.

post.sh might be used to run specific post-install tasks, like
installing additional sofware, clean up, and so on.

Change-Id: Ic69d4532a566a8e3071817d644fbb88de71eea0b

commit_message:
Using six.string_types for python3 compatible

For python3 compatible, using six.string_types instead of
basestring(). six.string_types represent basestring in
python2 and str in python3.

Change-Id: Ib4ba3d164f782601944023b99d6cc1ee2763ee85

commit_message:
Add logic to ensure vlan configuration is persisted

This fix adds an additional optional argument to the ensure-device script
of the network-utils element to allow the specification of the interface
raw device when the Neutron public interface is set to be a vlan. In such
an instance, the ensure-bridge script adds the vlan-raw-device and ip
link directives to the public interface stanza in the network interfaces
definition file.

Change-Id: I9d8195eb5b940938cb7580c810c1b5e8718f72a6
Closes-Bug: #1375422

commit_message:
add facility to gate-nova-tox-functional

Nova is going to add a new set of tests under the functional tox
target, this provides the facility to start running this in a
non-voting way as we bring in that code.

Change-Id: I785c0fd9cfa55dae693a8b4ad43ef48958962c39

[{'created': '2014-11-06 08:29:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Wrong Product ID for Intel NIC example

The example in the ini file contains Wrong Product ID for Intel NIC,
The current product ID belongs to the PF product,

commit_message:
Fix Wrong Product ID for Intel NIC example

The example in the ini file contains Wrong Product ID for Intel NIC,
The current product ID belongs to the PF product,
And it should be replaced with the product ID of the VF.

Change-Id: I48c1f6a3425bc85214bddf092444cc12667b8644
Closes-Bug: 1387152

A single plugin can be compatible with several versions
of fuel, it's the reason why fuel_version should be

Implements: blueprint cinder-neutron-plugins-in-fuel
"}]
commit_message:
fuel_version in metadata should be a list, not a string

A single plugin can be compatible with several versions
of fuel, it's the reason why fuel_version should be
an array of strings.

Change-Id: I42b462562fa6d112023c98e8f8cba7add6900608
Implements: blueprint cinder-neutron-plugins-in-fuel

I suppose if we are going to remove it, can you at least replace it with a #TODO to re-enable when py33 support is there?'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2014-09-03 15:11:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

i'm not sure why having a currently broken env is a problem.  can you explain?"}, {'account_id': 6524, 'date': '2014-09-03 15:24:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think py33 should remain as a constant reminder of what we should be striving for. I'd rather see py26 removed from this list."}, {'account_id': 10980, 'date': '2014-09-03 18:35:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> a constant reminder 

But it's not.  It just programs people to set TOXENV instead of letting the repo be internally consistent, which means they'll miss actually running py3 tests when support lands.

And we don't add tests for anything else that we want to head for in the future.  It'd be nothing but a sea of red if we did.

What makes this such a special snowflake, that it warrants perma-failure before the support actually exists?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-10-22 19:57:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2014-10-30 11:35:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10980, 'date': '2014-11-06 14:26:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Broad community support to leave broken tox in place, prior to the working fixes for py3.'}]

commit_message:
Install newer yum and yum-utils on precise

Fixes ISO build failure. Apparently the version of yum (and yum-utils)
shipped with precise is unable to handle OSCI repositories metadata.

Change-Id: Icf1b4226b7b6a73da821cdc2fef60372b1b4c9a2
Closes-bug: #1381535

commit_message:
Add clarifying error msg for property with wrong-type values

I don't really think, that this is useful patch,but following the
bug #1367375, some people filled string-type properties by non-string
values (e.g. value '42' for property 'key_name'). This is incorrect, 
but not critically wrong. So, recommended solution is wrapping
non-string values in quotes. And this patch helps people not to get
tripped up.

Change-Id: I53726103996e47ae94b420d208c9a83e2bf01b7a
Closes-bug: #1367375

commit_message:
Missed repo gate job for zuul layout filter.

In a previous patch, added a zuul layout filter to have the chef cookbook
jobs run on precise until we can finish the work for trusty support.
This missed the special repo job definition, so adding that in now.

Change-Id: I3a4fb88d0eec88550bb6fe3585056814b9e3f86a

This change add pipline configuration support to gether per device
rate metrics for instance. The per device rate metrics for instances
is transform from the metrics of per devices for instances by adding
metrics to disk_pipline in pipline cfg. These metrics will be independent
of the support of per devices rate metrics provided by inspector.

This thange will add the following metrics:
  - "disk.device.read.bytes.rate"
  - "disk.device.read.requests.rate"
  - "disk.device.write.bytes.rate"
  - "disk.device.write.requests.rate"

Change-Id: I908ab40cc77966238944060e33603c5f4c440634

commit_message:
Add per device rate metrics for instances

This change add pipline configuration support to gether per device
rate metrics for instance. The per device rate metrics for instances
is transform from the metrics of per devices for instances by adding
metrics to disk_pipline in pipline cfg. These metrics will be independent
of the support of per devices rate metrics provided by inspector.

This thange will add the following metrics:
  - "disk.device.read.bytes.rate"
  - "disk.device.read.requests.rate"
  - "disk.device.write.bytes.rate"
  - "disk.device.write.requests.rate"

Change-Id: I908ab40cc77966238944060e33603c5f4c440634

commit_message:
making service catalog for endpoints more configurable

When creating a client you may need the client to be something other
than the endpoint type of 'publicURL'. This will allow you to
overwrite the endpoint type of each service client.

Closes-Bug: #1389885
Change-Id: I117b2ec9397f5bdbc0861902e7e502a86a7b3c9e

commit_message:
Added title to show user on UI instead of internal plugin name

Also changed the format of fuel_version which should be a list
instead of string.

Related patches:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/132842/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/132851/

Change-Id: I95a7bbca8b8d88810b312c93096031f13c2b60ea
Implements: blueprint cinder-neutron-plugins-in-fuel

[{'created': '2014-11-05 12:21:21.000000000', 'message': 'Removed priority field for tasks

Removed priority field for each task, because
it can confuse the user, he already has stages
and there is no need to have another entity,
to define the order of several tasks within
single stage we can the order which the tasks
were defined in, e.g. Ansible uses the same
way, to define the order of tasks.

commit_message:
Removed priority field for tasks

Removed priority field for each task, because
it can confuse the user, he already has stages
and there is no need to have another entity,
to define the order of several tasks within
a single stage we can use the order which the
tasks were defined in, e.g. Ansible uses the
same way, to define the order of tasks.

Change-Id: Ie0539266a0339b2bbf2857c88694d0a691338ec6
Implements: blueprint cinder-neutron-plugins-in-fuel

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-06 12:40:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

commit_message:
fuel-upgrade: add --check-only option

This is used to perform preliminary upgrade checks only and not perform any
upgrade.

Change-Id: I205b97678efc9ee888bcc893a9d5e98b85f0db1c
Partial-Bug: #1389667
DocImpact

commit_message:
Partial fix missing keyboard focus from Console's iframe

The iframe in Instance Console doesn't get focus on loading, so the user
cannot type into the console, this change is focusing the iframe on
hovering mouse over it.

with '#' will be ignored, and an empty message aborts the commit.  # On
branch partialfix_console_iframe_focus # Changes to be committed: # (use
"git reset HEAD <file>..." to unstage) # #	modified:
openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/templates/instances/_detail_console.html

Partial-Bug: #1389117 Change-Id:
I39fb5a26645d3805070a875386ec91b8048b8c79

Change-Id: I3c5108b0ff00ce83b6fd50a06f82f2cf615d4b65

commit_message:
Add Sample ReST API path in webapi document

Sample type has been described in webapi document, but API path is
missing, this patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I09248aac036479c9ccd250824de4df05713bfaa1
Closes-Bug: #1388507

commit_message:
Deploy Ceilometer alarm services to the devtest overcloud controller

Adds Ceilometer alarm-evaluator and alarm-notifier to the list of services
provided to DIB for the overcloud-control node.

Relies on: I223d24256dcd4e9515149bdbdb9d021b0ef4d00e

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow

Hi, Ildiko Vancsa, can you provide a reference to OS manual which you mentioned.

I noticed that mongodb_replica_set and event_connection are introduced in Kilo, but not present in http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/ch_configuring-openstack-telemetry.html, so it seems only updated after each main version is released, see http://docs.openstack.org/juno/config-reference/content/doc_change_history.html.

Anyway, it is ok to me, if it is automatically collect information from each project, then it is perfect.

So, are we going to remove the doc/source/configuration.rst in Kilo release? Should we leave a message in that file for developers just like what we do in Web API 1?'}, {'account_id': 9562, 'date': '2014-11-05 15:12:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@ZhiQiang: Yes, I meant that reference, I talked to the docco team, they update the docs master more often, than one/release cycle. I do not know the history of that history, maybe that shows the history of the frozen content for each major release. And not the whole file will be removed, you will see my patch when it's finally ready (note that Kilo Summit is ongoing this week), I will add reference to the OpenStack Manuals.

Best Regards,
Ildiko"}, {'account_id': 6676, 'date': '2014-11-05 15:50:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@Ildiko Vancsa

[{'created': '2014-11-04 05:55:44.000000000', 'message': 'VMware: Enable VMware inspector to support any port

If vCenter is configured to use any port other than 443,
the inspector fails to connect to vCenter.
This patch adds a configurable parameter host_port in
ceilometer config under vmware section.

Change-Id: I9035b32ffbc58bb1801b02abdce4bc83a3427308
Closes-Bug: #1387050

commit_message:
VMware: Enable VMware inspector to support any port

If vCenter is configured to use any port other than 443,
the inspector fails to connect to vCenter.
This patch adds a configurable parameter host_port in
ceilometer config under vmware section.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I9035b32ffbc58bb1801b02abdce4bc83a3427308
Closes-Bug: #1387050

commit_message:
Remove warning about puppet log parsing

Change-Id: I38a3684de10116f50e042c9a10f954c32b0ba021

[{'created': '2014-11-03 10:11:52.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor the stop operation for neutron-dhcp-agent.

* Combine the stopping of neutron-dhcp-agent and the stopping of dnsmasq
processes inside namespaces into one time period (it was only for stopping of

Closes-Bug: 1377906

commit_message:
Refactor the stop operation for neutron-dhcp-agent.

* Combine the stopping of neutron-dhcp-agent and the stopping of dnsmasq
processes inside namespaces into one time period (it was only for stopping of
ONE neutron dhcp process).
* Clean up duplicate code.

Change-Id: Iaaa2b6f7c8e3b0fa870715c69fd39fa45e5dc526
Closes-Bug: 1377906

commit_message:
Fix configuration of security group driver

The security group driver is correctly configured by default
(neutron.agent.linux.iptables_firewall.OVSHybridIptablesFirewallDriver)
and it should be the same both in Neutron and plugin configuration files.

Change-Id: I78adf19aca2123748876fb7047306604fc905a34
Closes-bug: #1350875

commit_message:
Clarify note on QCOW2 uploads

Reworded paragraph on converting images to QCOW2 before upload, since
it might be faster to upload a smaller QCOW2 image instead of a RAW image.

Change-Id: I32fc57d2dda36c5d3c1f5d21aaaaa2a8044cd0a2
Closes-Bug: 1384011
(cherry picked from commit 4b971cb8cd6f62c73a97630cf9e903c4f22ee41d)

commit_message:
fuel_upgrade: add ability to use diff-based repo

In Fuel 6.0 we're going to introduce diff-based releases, so the
fuel-upgrade script has to handle and install it properly.

(cherry picked from commit 21a21ed2acfa42aebf0f6551fa3329c9f2b00522)

Blueprint: reduce-tarball-size
Change-Id: If05ac74b680691bf9adb54caf8958e235ec767ef

commit_message:
Use masks in release orchestrator_data

Since Fuel Upgrade feature, it's a common practice to add new
openstack release, so it'd be very useful to add new release
with a kind of macro replacement in paths to repos and puppets.

Since this commit, the macro replacement for MASTER_IP was
introduced.

(cherry picked from commit 2488bffd55baee84b33366ac9e4eef62dbd70607)

Closes-Bug: #1378901
Change-Id: Ie3a79ab105461f10cbabcc5353ca952946200f32

commit_message:
Pool Manager - BIND9 Pool Backend Driver Fixes

BIND9 Global Option Changes:
- Provide default ([127.0.0.1:5354]) for masters option
(master is now of the form <ip-address>:<port>)

BIND9 Server Specific Option Changes:
- Provide default (127.0.0.1) for host option

Additional Changes:
- Update designate.conf.sample
- Retrieve backend option values when backend driver is initialized to improve
performance
- Provide minimum validation of masters backend option

Change-Id: Ic9ffa51b2ee6c273e246a3dd7cc96cf7180d8f95
Partially-implements: blueprint server-pools-service

commit_message:
Support puppet hook processing by PuppetD

Instead of using execute_shell_command magent
now puppet hooks will be processing by algorithm
which we used to run puppet for main deployment.

This changes give us ability to run complex
puppet manifests with a lot of modules.

Change-Id: I7201a35501802b342fa708ee9e8f29087ce4a302
Implements: blueprint cinder-neutron-plugins-in-fuel

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2014-11-06 08:22:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)

Looks fine, minor comment re the repetition in the if/else, but I won't block on it.

FWIW I think we should be looking at deprecating this tool soon (during kilo), so if you're using it, please consider migrating to python-openstackclient instead.

The reasons for deprecation:

1. It duplicates an interface openstackclient already provides

2. openstackclient is the official CLI interface to keystone v3, this isn't (it was supposed to be a temporary hack to help tripleo while they transitioned to openstackclient)

3. It's not tested in any CI (openstackclient is, as devstack uses it)

All of this makes me worry that folks are expending significant effort maintaining this tool, instead of e.g replacing it with a couple of lines of shell-script wrapping openstackclient.

If there are barriers to your adoption of openstackclient (other than the tiny amount of additional convenience this script offers), please ping me with details so we can discuss it, thanks!"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-06 08:22:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Verified

commit_message:
Add CERT file support in heat-keystone-setup-domain

Add below options to support ssl connection.
--insecure
--os-cacert
--os-cert
--os-key

Change-Id: I9d1fd07df783d7410ac3f51b5d4e8434d57182a4
Close-bug: #1387063

[{'created': '2014-10-09 08:24:10.000000000', 'message': "Make Keystone domain calls using domain_id and not domain_name

There's an API call being made to keystone using domain_name to resolve
the domain_id that doesn't exist currently.

We could just as well get the domain_id attribute from the domain_admin_client
property and use it.

Change-Id: I64fe132d1ddd5f0e6ed65c0c1d2caa8b9bec4376
Partial-Bug: #1376213

commit_message:
Make Keystone domain calls using domain_id and not domain_name

There's an API call being made to keystone using domain_name to resolve
the domain_id that doesn't exist currently.

We could just as well get the domain_id attribute from the domain_admin_client
property and use it.

Change-Id: I64fe132d1ddd5f0e6ed65c0c1d2caa8b9bec4376
Partial-Bug: #1376213

Added reset_to_discover method which should be used
when node resetted to discovery state.
- Reconfigure volumes
- Move roles to pendings roles

commit_message:
Refactor reset_to_discover procedure

Added reset_to_discover method which should be used
when node resetted to discovery state.
- Reconfigure volumes
- Move roles to pendings roles
- Remove assigned ip address
- Set pending addition

Change-Id: I07f1d12f904e8faa76e35f00a49a978a6643eb20
Closes-Bug: 1389572
Related-Bug: 1273006

commit_message:
Make ceilometer dbsync command timeout to be an optional parameter

The default dbsync command timeout value 3600 seconds may be too small
when there are large data in ceilometer database.
Make timeout to be optional to fix this problem.

Change-Id: Id4e703fab260f8e010ff089e4134e7aab8e21fd2
Closes-bug: #1389111

messages:
[{'account_id': 13769, 'date': '2014-11-01 15:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2014-11-01 15:55:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-11-01 16:03:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-13 15:19:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for adopt glance.store library in Glance

The store module is removed from glance project and new glance_store
module is created, but the glance project code was not updated
properly for the required changes.

_get_from_store and _get_size methods raises store.NotFound exception
from glance_store but not caught in the glance api.

Updated exception.NotFound to store.NotFound which returns 404 NotFound
response to the user.

Closes-Bug: #1380552
Change-Id: I068cb90f5db62443115157a027fbdefec9bd4a00
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for adopt glance.store library in Glance

The store module is removed from glance project and new glance_store
module is created, but the glance project code was not updated
properly for the required changes.

_get_from_store and _get_size methods raises store.NotFound exception
from glance_store but not caught in the glance api.

Updated exception.NotFound to store.NotFound which returns 404 NotFound
response to the user.

Closes-Bug: #1380552
Change-Id: I068cb90f5db62443115157a027fbdefec9bd4a00

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-30 09:08:57.000000000', 'message': "Optimize neutron-api waiting cycle

Currently there're 60 attempts to reach Neutron API with short delays between
them. It leads to very slow deployment failure in case of network problems,
because client's connection to server hangs for 60 seconds itself.
The idea is to decrease number of attempts but increase the delay, it should be
more optimal for different cases.

Change-Id: Icc4caa3c4eb3d22f24ff9ae7066ad1e60e65bb18
Related-bug: #1384332
"}, {'created': '2014-10-30 15:58:25.000000000', 'message': "Optimize neutron-api waiting cycle

Currently there're 60 attempts to reach Neutron API with short delays between
them. It leads to very slow deployment failure in case of network problems,
because client's connection to server hangs for 60 seconds itself.
The idea is to change default timeout for Neutron HTTP connection.

Change-Id: Icc4caa3c4eb3d22f24ff9ae7066ad1e60e65bb18
Related-bug: #1384332
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize neutron-api waiting cycle

Currently there're 60 attempts to reach Neutron API with short delays between
them. It leads to very slow deployment failure in case of network problems,
because client's connection to server hangs for 60 seconds itself.
The idea is to change default timeout for Neutron HTTP connection.

Change-Id: Icc4caa3c4eb3d22f24ff9ae7066ad1e60e65bb18
Related-bug: #1384332

commit_message:
Code cleanup: use oslo's to_slug() instead of slugify()

The bash completion code is the sole user of the slugify() function
in utils, which is substantially similar to to_slug() provided in
strutils from oslo. Remove slugify() and use to_slug() instead.

Closes-bug: #1266127
Change-Id: I52d8c1ae8846adb4a7da584fcee183230102c958

commit_message:
Return HTTP 400 if use invalid fixed ip to attach interface

When posting an 'attach interface' request to Nova with an invalid fixed ip,
Nova need to return HTTP 400, instead of HTTP 500, in order to inform the
user to correct the fixed ip in HTTP request. It is an API v2 only problem.

Change-Id: I34fc813f38b463460c59672e6c3364aea9ef347d
Closes-Bug: 1365579

This patch is not sufficient: it disables raising an exception but doesn't fix the underlying problem: just like live migration before https://review.openstack.org/91722 , rebuild makes an assumption that ephmeral block devices are stored as files under instance path, which doesn't apply with RBD.

What I believe will happen with this patch is that nova-compute will proceed with rebuild without creating the instance path and populating instance xml on the destination node, and so will fail to launch the instance. Can you describe how you tested this fix?

P.S. CephFS (unlike RBD) has nothing to do with OpenStack, no need to even mention it anywhere in the commit."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2014-09-19 03:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2014-09-19 03:49:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2014-09-19 03:51:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks for the comments, Dmitry. I missed a change in manager.py. Please review it again and let me know if you have any concern. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-09-19 05:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified-1

(2 comments)

This looks ok, but the patch seems two different problems with evacuation of instances. Moreover, even this patch applied evacuation is still broken: when the original host is back online, it finds out that the instance has been evacuated and tries to delete it and its files, despite the fact that the image is stored in RBD. Apparently, this fails due to the fact the image is actually being used by the instance on another host: http://paste.openstack.org/show/115023/

How about we split this into 3 patches?

- 1st would fix the propagation of recreate flag

- 2nd would fix the detection of shared storage

- 3rd would make sure nova-compute doesn't try to delete a shared image when the original host is back online

I don't insist on this, but let's at least make sure we've fixed the evacuation entirely."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2014-09-25 03:52:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2014-09-25 03:59:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

Thank you for the review and test, Roman. I have added some new change to address the nova-compute init host issue. But personally, I still prefer to keep these changes in one commit because it would be easier for review, test and backport to icehouse. Most important, I think it's a complete solution for the nova evacuate issue on rbd scenario. Thanks again for your comments and review. Cheers."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-09-25 05:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

@garyk, thanks for the review.

"Are these 3 changes independent of one another?"

IMO, they're related. Without anyone of them, you can't get the nova evacuate workflow works for RBD. Without #1 and #2, the nova evacuate command will fail, without the #3, the broken host can't be restarted. 

I'm OK to split the patch into 2. The other reason I want to keep them together is to facilitate the backporting. Since we need to backport it to Juno and Icehouse.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2014-10-24 13:52:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-09-16 04:01:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix 'on-shared-storage' check of evacuate for RBD

Based on current implement, nova evacuate and nova rebuild
are sharing some code. When user enable the on_shared_storage
option for nova evacuate, nova will check if the instance
path is accessiable. For the RBD scenario(without CephFS),
the volume(block) is sharing between different hosts indeed.
Though the path isn't sharing at the filesystem level. This
patch fixes this issue and adds test cases for that.

Closes-Bug: 1340411

Change-Id: Idc8c45b055e986cf85730235d5d25777632ad1c1

"}, {'created': '2014-10-14 02:09:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix nova evacuate issues for RBD

For RBD scenario, there are some issues in Nova code
now against evacuate function:

1. Based on current implementation, nova evacuate and
nova rebuild are sharing some code. When user enables
the on_shared_storage option for nova evacuate, nova
will check if the instance path is accessible. For
the RBD scenario, the volume(block) is shared between
different hosts, though the path isn't shared at the
filesystem level. This patch fixes this issue and adds
test cases for that.

2. Missing the 'recreate' parameter for rebuild method.

3. After evacuated successfully, and restarting the failed
host to get it back. Nova will call init_host() and then
call method _destroy_evacuated_instances(). In method
_destroy_evacuated_instances(), nova will check again if
the storage is shared or not to decide if the storage
should be destroyed. Now nova is using temp file to check
if it's shared file system, but it's wrong for RBD case.
so Nova will run into a failure to fail to delete the
block storage, since it's used by the new instance. This
patch fixes this issue and adds test cases for that.

Closes-Bug: 1249319
Closes-Bug: 1340411

Change-Id: Idc8c45b055e986cf85730235d5d25777632ad1c1
"}, {'created': '2014-10-14 04:03:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix nova evacuate issues for RBD

For RBD scenario, there are some issues in Nova code
now against evacuate function:

1. Based on current implementation, nova evacuate and
nova rebuild are sharing some code. When user enables
the on_shared_storage option for nova evacuate, nova
will check if the instance path is accessible. For
the RBD scenario, the volume(block) is shared between
different hosts, though the path isn't shared at the
filesystem level. This patch fixes this issue and adds
test cases for that.

2. Missing the 'recreate' parameter for rebuild method.

3. After evacuated successfully, and restarting the failed
host to get it back. Nova will call init_host() and then
call method _destroy_evacuated_instances(). In method
_destroy_evacuated_instances(), nova will check again if
the storage is shared or not to decide if the storage
should be destroyed. Now nova is using temp file to check
if it's shared file system, but it's wrong for RBD case.
so Nova will run into a failure to fail to delete the

"}, {'created': '2014-10-20 02:01:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix nova evacuate issues for RBD

For RBD scenario, there are some issues in Nova code
now against evacuate function:

1. Based on current implementation, nova evacuate and
nova rebuild are sharing some code. When user enables
the on_shared_storage option for nova evacuate, nova
will check if the instance path is accessible. For
the RBD scenario, the volume(block) is shared between
different hosts, though the path isn't shared at the
filesystem level. This patch fixes this issue and adds
test cases for that.

2. Missing the 'recreate' parameter for rebuild method.
Issue is fixed in this patch and test case is added as
well.

3. After evacuated successfully, and restarting the failed
host to get it back. Nova will call init_host() and then
call method _destroy_evacuated_instances(). In method
_destroy_evacuated_instances(), nova will check again if
the storage is shared or not to decide if the storage
should be destroyed. Now nova is using temp file to check
if it's shared file system, but it's wrong for RBD case.
so Nova will run into a failure to fail to delete the
block storage, since it's used by the new instance. This
patch fixes this issue and adds test cases for that.

Closes-Bug: 1249319
Closes-Bug: 1340411

call method _destroy_evacuated_instances(). In method

the on_shared_storage option for nova evacuate, nova
will check if the instance path is accessible. For
the RBD scenario, the volume(block) is shared between

2. Missing the 'recreate' parameter for rebuild method.

For RBD scenario, there are some issues in Nova code
now against evacuate function:

1. Based on current implementation, nova evacuate and
nova rebuild are sharing some code. When user enables
the on_shared_storage option for nova evacuate, nova
will check if the instance path is accessible. For
the RBD scenario, the volume(block) is shared between
different hosts, though the path isn't shared at the
filesystem level. This patch fixes this issue and adds
test cases for that.

2. Missing the 'recreate' parameter for rebuild method.
Though the libvirt driver doesn't implement rebuild
method(only Ironic driver implements it), but we really
need to set 'recreate' in kwargs so it gets passed to
_rebuild_default_impl so we don't call driver.destroy
on evacuate for shared filesystem/block storage cases.
It is fixed in this patch and test case is added as well.

Closes-Bug: 1249319
Closes-Bug: 1340411

Change-Id: Idc8c45b055e986cf85730235d5d25777632ad1c1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix nova evacuate issues for RBD

For RBD scenario, there are some issues in Nova code
now against evacuate function:

1. Based on current implementation, nova evacuate and
nova rebuild are sharing some code. When user enables
the on_shared_storage option for nova evacuate, nova
will check if the instance path is accessible. For
the RBD scenario, the volume(block) is shared between
different hosts, though the path isn't shared at the
filesystem level. This patch fixes this issue and adds
test cases for that.

2. Missing the 'recreate' parameter for rebuild method.
Though the libvirt driver doesn't implement rebuild
method(only Ironic driver implements it), but we really
need to set 'recreate' in kwargs so it gets passed to
_rebuild_default_impl so we don't call driver.destroy
on evacuate for shared filesystem/block storage cases.
It is fixed in this patch and test case is added as well.

Closes-Bug: 1249319
Closes-Bug: 1340411

Change-Id: Idc8c45b055e986cf85730235d5d25777632ad1c1

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow
